Ideal candidate brings some impressive know-how (and the understanding that there’s always more to learn) SQL experience a big plus Willingness to travel

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe project is to be carried out at Rolls-Royce@NTU Corporate Lab. It focuses on development of localised heat treatment techniques for repair and restoration of airfoils. Technologies such as gas jet impingement and electropulsing will be explored for relief of residual stresses or improvement of microstructures. As a Research Assistant, you will be supporting the Project Lead to deliver the project, ensuring that the overall project output meets the requirements. These range from fundamental technical research, to design of experiments, to control project spending. You will be dealing with customers and stakeholders and will be accountable for the successful delivery to cost, specification and time. Your key role, whilst not exhaustive will include:  Work with internal team members, interfacing teams, partners and suppliers to ensure technical requirements are understood as required Develop Design of experiments (DoE) plan Plan and execute experiments Capture and analyse data Resolve technical problems Perform technical research and technical report writing
job_requirements: Requirements BEng degree (with 1st class honours) or Master Degree by research in relevant area Experience in using technical problem solving tools Familiar with super alloys Background in CFD modelling Preferably strong in mechanical design Preferably experienced in project management General understanding of the jet engine’s architecture Clear logical thinker with good planning abilities. Good communicator capable of motivating others and leading a small team.

company_name: Avago Technologies International Sales Pte. Limited
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThis position is responsible to provide broad and deep subject-matter expertise, extensive thought leadership and acute solution/technical specialization within and/or across Broadcom Software Enterprise products and solutions in a manner that best positions Broadcom against our competition. Responsible for presales and product adoption activities for key solution areas that result in the ability for the field organization to deliver to the client a proven, repeatable, multi-product solution and/or cross business-segments multi-product integration. This position is challenged with taking a customer's business strategy and creating a solution-based design based on Broadcom's product portfolio.  This job position is AIOps division that is responsible for the end user, application, infrastructure and network monitoring solutions.   Key Responsibilities  This position must be seen by the customer as bringing tangible value in terms of experience, knowledge and expertise. This is achieved through a combination of broad real-world experience and IT industry-specific certifications. Overall position responsibilities include but are not limited to: Working closely with the account team and the customer or partner on product sales, adoption, and expansion opportunities.  This includes doing demoes, POC’s, RFP/RFI’s and product adoption activities. Working closely with the account team and the customer or partner to obtain a deep understanding of the customer's technology needs or partner's offerings and architect a solution to meet them. Building relationships across customer's or partner's IT silos and offerings to understand, build, document and share our knowledge of their infrastructure, challenges and potential technical impact of planned projects. Understand and act as a valued resource early and often within the customer's decision-making process (e.g.: during the idea or conceptual stages). Consult and provide technical coordination in the development of solution offerings to support sales opportunities. Lead and/or support trouble-shooting and adoption initiatives as required to achieve CA and Customer objectives. Design, develop, and validate solution prototypes in lab environment. Review and certify the accuracy, completeness and viability of solution designs and implementations. Foster and build relationships with customers and partners to develop references. Strive to constantly improve the quality of all customer interactions.    Typical Role Definition  Technical Leadership. Possesses and applies a comprehensive knowledge of a particular field of specialization to complete complex assignments. Internally recognized as an expert technical or business contributor. May be known as an emerging externally recognized premier technical, industry, product or business specialist. Works on unusually complex problems or business issues requiring state of the art technical or industry knowledge and where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of multiple competing intangibles. Known in the function as the ‘knowledge base’ of information for the function or ‘sub-function’ and the in-house expert (SME) on specific technologies and practices. Integrates research and emerging technologies into company product platforms and programs. Often leads significant projects or initiatives that have major impact on company business results. Champions significant projects, programs, and business initiatives using demonstrated creativity and ingenuity. Operates with considerable latitude for unsupervised actions or decisions. May be responsible for a project team with a defined scope of responsibility and set of deliverables. Has influence over team members; encourages focus on ingenuity and results. Reviews progress and evaluates results. Plans and assigns personnel for a given project or task and recommends changes in procedures. Often plays a role in high-level projects that have an impact on the company’s future direction.
job_requirements: RequirementsBusiness Travel and Physical Demands Business travel of approximately 50 or more percent yearly is expected for this position. Office environment. No special physical demands required.   Preferred Education Bachelor's Degree or global equivalent in Computer Science or business-related field.   Work Experience  Typically, 10 or more years of detailed technical industry related experience. Significant experience working with customers, sales personnel and/or customer services. Significant experience and understanding related industry disciplines and technologies and related application experience (i.e. DevOps, Docker, Kubernetes, Java, .NET, Node.js, SQL as well as operating system administration). Experience resolving more complex technical issues and integration of multiple products to create solutions    Key Competencies include:  Customer Focus: Act in ways that demonstrate customer focus and satisfaction by building effective relationships with customers, identifying, meeting and exceeding customer expectations, and by treating customers with dignity and respect. Knowledge and Application of Broadcom Solution Sets: Possesses a broad and deep understanding of Broadcom's products and range of solution sets, how to identify the best possible solutions to meet customers' business needs and how to appropriately position Broadcom solutions with customers. Effective Communication: Deliver outstanding oral and written communications that are impactful and persuasive with their intended audience. Industry Knowledge: Possess in-depth knowledge and expertise of given industry and relevant marketplace; can speak with authority, e.g., on industry trends, best practices, competitive practices, regulatory issues, etc. Effective Selling: Utilize solutions-oriented, systematic approach to selling, leverage mastery of sales best practices and Broadcom’s sales methodology. Business Acumen: Understand key aspects of business, e.g., business models and competitive positioning; also understand how business operates, including role of structure, systems, and processes; can speak in business language when applying professional expertise. Leadership: Support coaching and mentoring of Presales and Account Management colleagues.

You can articulate how your work improves the long term viability of the communities that we serve.   Master’s Degree business administration or related field study  Substantial and progressively responsible high level experience in digital assets systems and marketplace with progressive roles and accountability in a digital asset environment.  Master’s Degree preferred,  Significant senior level operational experience in a nonprofit blockchain community preferred.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesMAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Sanofi is engaging into a review program for harmonization of its current processes: Finance and Controlling, SBS, Trade, Customer Service, Supply Chain. In line with the Shift Program, BOOST is one of the key Finance Transformation initiatives that will drive the simplification and standardization of our forecasting/budgeting/management reporting processes through a TM1 solution at “country” and “above country” levels, including the launch of an Analytic Center of Excellence model. The scope is Global and includes all Global Business Units, Global Support Functions, R&D and Industrial Affairs. This enhanced TM1 Core Model & Decision Support relies on 3 major drivers :  Acceleration of the country TM1 core model roll-out in all geographies Implementation of dedicated reporting TM1 solution per GBU and Global Functions for above country reporting needs Launch of Analytic COE model to industrialize the maintenance of the data, management of submissions and delivery of standard reports to the business partners    In this context, the main duties of the ITS TM1 Architect are:   Collaboration:  Assist ITS Boost Program manager to mobilize the ITS project team, regional network of experts and other ITS contributors and organize their contribution Help ITS Boost Program Manager on reporting tasks Communicate if risks and issues are identified, formalized & shared with the ITS Boost Program Manager Proactively share on contractor or personal engagement with team     Design of the Solution  Participate and organize with his/her functional teams and regional contributors the design of the solution for the business processes and impacts analysis for satellite applications Participate and organize with his/her integration teams the design of transversal processes, such as Analytics, MDM, Internal control, User access management In coordination with ITS Boost Program leader, insure the overall consistency of the design proposed by ITS. Deliver all design deliverables defined by the program and under ITS responsibility (e.g. specifications, …)    Development and testing  Participate with his/her functional and integration teams and other ITS contributors the development specifications and testing Participate and organize with his/her IT teams developments Participate and organize the ITS contribution to user acceptance tests and finalize the solution (and address defects identified). Ensure that all team members use properly the documentation and testing tools as defined by ITS quality department. Complete all deliverables defined by the program and under ITS responsibility (e.g. test protocols, test reports…)      Migration and go-live  Strongly participate with his/her functional and integration teams and other ITS contributors the ITS migration and go-live activities Strongly participate in insuring the documentation and execution of ITS cut-over activities Strongly participate in insuring go-live support and hypercare activities    Technical integration and Infrastructure  Communicate and participate with his/her IT teams and with ITS/IS the design of the technical architecture, technical integration and tooling required for the project management. Communicate and participate with his/her IT teams and with ITS/IS the overall infrastructure required for the project      Roll-out strategy and roadmap  Communicate and participate with his/her Roadmap and acceleration team the investigation of the different deployment options possible and define the best possible strategy, taking into consideration the benefits, the costs, the technical restrictions and cultural implications) in coordination with ITS Boost Program Manager Communicate and participate with his/her Roadmap and acceleration team the definition of the rollout roadmap and the decision criteria to be considered (business value, integration with other initiatives, specific countries considerations, risks, …) in coordination with ITS Boost Program Manager. Communicate and participate with his/her Roadmap and acceleration team the identification of the project acceleration enablers and organize them in a secured & industrialized way. He/she will consider them in the detailed planning of the project implementation for pilots and deployments phases in coordination with ITS Boost Program Manager.
job_requirements: RequirementsREQUIREMENTS   EDUCATIONAL BACKGROUND  Higher education (master’s degree) with an orientation in business related fields. Valuable Master in Finance, Master in IT or Engineering    PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE  5 years professional experience on TM1 Demonstrate a very good track record in TM1 architecture and development preferably in a Pharmaceutical / Consumer Products industry. Strong experience and expertise on TM1 projects in complex and international environment Very good general understanding of business processes. At ease with Microsoft Office tools, and in general with IS tools. Analytical and summarization skills Strong communication and problem solving skills, ability to defend the Core Model position    MAJOR SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES  Ability to challenge, open minded and active listening Ability to drive change and ensure alignment at every stage from main stakeholders and impacted parties Ability to understand and synthesize business needs from multiple sources, and identify arbitration needs Ability to keep global picture and global roadmap in mind Have superior communication and interaction skills, including tact and diplomacy Ability to collect data and report blocking points Issue resolution and value realization oriented Accountability, reliability

company_location: Singapore Wine Vault Building, 6 Fishery Port Road 619747
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs one of the fastest growing e-commerce and logistics companies in Asia, RedMart offers an unparalleled scaling a startup experience. Our culture: entrepreneurial, fiercely intelligent, team oriented, deeply creative and whatever you add to it!  We’re fanatical about improving our customer experience and providing “wow” customer service. We're interested in talented, creative and passionate people joining our All-Star team who believe in our mission: To save our customers time and money for the important things in life!   Our Fulfillment Center technology team’s mission is to improve safety, quality of service, predictability, productivity, and throughput in our warehouses through technology, algorithmic optimization, and process and equipment innovation. We are looking for software quality engineers who care deeply about customers and users and serve as their champions, have excellent software development and test automation skills, and are passionate about engineering quality. Your role is to help define and implement the best test methodologies to release high quality products/services, while demonstrating a sense of complete ownership and adding a strong dose of software craftsmanship to the team.    As a Senior Quality Engineer you will:  Work as part of a cross-functional team of talented software engineers, product managers and industrial engineers that has full ownership of all warehouse software and hardware technology, processes and equipment. (We call these RED teams.) The team builds software systems (ex. WMS) and designs processes that run our fulfillment center, including receiving, slotting, putaway, replenishment, picking and staging. You’ll need to have superb communication skills and thrive in a collaborative environment and be committed to the success of the team as a whole.   Learn the business and get close to users and customers. To build software for the fulfillment center, first hand experience with operations in our fulfillment center has no substitute. In addition to customer and user interaction, you will need to build close relationships with the internal business stakeholders for your domain.   Have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define product features, using innovative test technologies, and spearheading best practices that enable a quality product.   Participate in design and code reviews. Ensuring testability in product features and measure code coverage data regularly.   Champion Engineering Excellence best practices, pushing quality upstream and drive the software development process toward quality-centric methodologies.   Lead the creation of a test strategies. Perform all aspects of non-functional testing like scalability, performance, security and privacy testing while simulating real life environments through automated/white-box techniques.   Perform debugging and troubleshooting in variety of local and remote testing environments as well as in production as required.   Design and develop automated tools or frameworks for highly optimized and effective test coverage.
job_requirements: RequirementsOur Tech Stack:  Microservices written in Java or Scala using Play Framework and Akka. React or AngularJs for web apps. MongoDB, PostgreSQL for storage. AWS infrastructure, with HAProxy, Nginx, Redis. Chef deployments. GitHub, Travis CI and JIRA for development tools. Testing with JUnit, ScalaTest, Mocha, FrisbyJS, Calabash and Selenium. AWS Kinesis, Spark and AWS Redshift for our data infrastructure.    What do we look for in a candidate?  Customer focus and a passion for quality   Business understanding. Having an in depth understanding of the business processes and the role software plays in those processes. You are able to use this understanding to define what automation is required to maximize business stability with each release.   Perseverance. Building a great company that customers love is hard work. Many challenges await and we are looking for team members we can count on when things get tough.   Impact. We are result oriented. We value people who focus on the right things and get them done.   Strong coding and design ability. You write code that's clean and well structured. Your designs are pragmatic, appropriate to the the problem at hand, but can also be evolved over time. You are able to write native JavaScript, not just glue libraries together.   8+ years of software development and/or test experience with fluency in web related technologies. Familiarity with shipping large scale, distributed software services and broad understanding of quality engineering principles and test development methodologies and metrics. Experience testing REST APIs is ideal.   Experience creating simple, maintainable, reliable, secure and efficient test automation. Ability to work with and improve our test infrastructure, create reliable tests quickly, and understand the code you are testing.   Experience writing automated tests and Knowledge of testing tools. You should have experience with at least a few automation tools & frameworks like ​JUnit, JMeter, Selenium, Calabash, Karma, Jasmine, Frisby, Mocha.   Strong communications skills and ability to collaborate and work well with other disciplines and teams.   Bonus: Experience testing iOS/Android mobile platforms.

Coaches Dealer staff in effective utilisation of processes and reporting procedures and key performance indicators/measures. Appropriately uses help chains to resolve customer concerns in a timely manner. Applies a consultative, business advisory approach to partner with dealerships to identify opportunities for business development and/or improvements to Service and Parts and Accessories areas. Acts as a feedback conduit and liaison for Service Operations and Parts, Accessories and Clothing. Monitors dealer Service and After Sales training participation and influences dealerships on value of highly trained and knowledgeable staff.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for a candidate to fill a variety of support and admin matters for our executives’ members (i.e. Associate Directors and above) in our firm. We expect our executive assistant will maintain the strictest adherences to both client and staff confidentiality. Our company is a leading business adviser that helps dynamic organisations to unlock their potential for growth. Our company provides full services in audit, tax and advisory to our clients. Administrative and reporting:  Primarily working with high-level executives in our firm to provide top-level assistance; Handling incoming and outgoing communication, filing and clerical work, executive assistants; Support high-level executives in scheduling meetings, maintaining complex filing systems and databases, document review and preparation and possibly overseeing other staff  Office Management  Managing the office services, including the personnel, operations and procedures Oversee the daily correspondence; designing filing systems; reviewing and approving supply requisitions; assigning and monitoring clerical functions. Maintains office efficiency by planning and implementing office systems, layouts, data management, and equipment procurement. Designs and implements office policies by establishing standards, best practices, and procedures Maintains office staff job results by coaching and counseling employees; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results. Achieves financial objectives by preparing an annual budget; scheduling expenditures; analyzing variances; initiating corrective actions.  Front desk (when required):  Manning receptionist desk (phone answering, and relaying of telephone messages, greeting, directing and assisting visitors) during lunch hour; and In the absence of the receptionist, you must be able to man the receptionist desk, coordinate messenger, courier service, switch board and administer firm’s independence & conflict checks.
job_requirements: RequirementsJob Skills and Attributes  Have at least 4 – 6 years of relevant experience working with high-level executives and administrative work Preferably with a diploma graduate or equivalent Ability to work with all levels of internal management and staff as well as external clients and vendors Ability to priorities work allocated and multitask Listening and Communication Skills: You will be expected to follow instruction from your supervisor, and your ability to understand those instructions with little or no follow up will be appreciated by your boss. Also, you might need to relate messages or instructions to others based from your supervisor. Good listening and communication skills ensures that the information is relayed correctly. People/Interpersonal Skills: You will be working directly with at least one person: your boss. But you also might be the first line of communication between your boss and the outside world, potentially speaking with clients, other employees and upper management. Organizational Skills: Your supervisor will likely rely on you to keep the working day in order. Scheduling meetings, travel plans, billing, etc. will all require you to have terrific organizational skills. Computer Skills: Writing emails, transcribing notes, faxing, copying, and creating spreadsheets or printing documents figure heavily in an executive assistant's day. Minimum MS office skills required.  What we can offer We offer you competitive salary and benefits, an inclusive and collaborative work environment, with many opportunities to grow and develop through advising an interesting local and multinational client base. Please send your application to career@sg.gt.com, with the position title as the subject of the e-mail.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for a postdoctoral researcher to investigate the stability of future distribution systems. The objective is to develop new ways to quantify stability margins in networks consisting of microgrid clusters, distributed generation, and demand response services. This work takes a data analytical approach, building on the existing research in machine learning, statistical analysis, and signal-processing.   The applicant needs to have a Ph.D. degree in electrical engineering or computer science. Expertise in system identification, control theory, computational social science, and high-performance computing will be preferred. Past experience in power systems is also recommended.   The salary is competitive and depends on the experience of the applicant. The successful candidate will be offered a contract of up to 2 years. The candidate will be involved in writing scientific papers and funding proposals.   Applying candidates are invited to submit: 1) Curriculum Vitae, and 2) a recent published paper/report relevant to this position.
job_requirements: RequirementsPh.D. degree in electrical engineering or computer science. The applicant should be an expert in the fields such as power engineering, power electronics, machine learning, statistics, and signal-processing.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description : Reliability Engineer  Responsible for improving the reliability of site wide instrumentation and electrical installations by applying principles of Reliability Centered Maintenance. Apply Root Cause Analysis methodologies to improve instrumentation and electrical installations that support manufacturing operations in a dynamic, fast-paced cGMP, biotechnology environment. Measure reliability performance and demonstrate success of improvements. Manage reliability driven actions that require independent and/or collaborative judgment. Demonstrate ability as technical advisor to projects. Responsibilities   Change Control: provide Engineering Impact Assessments of Changes Develop, assess, optimize and maintain BOM and spare parts lists (EPL) Ensure instrument and electrical installation master list and drawings are kept updated Identify, develop and present business case to management on Reliability Improvement projects and participate in capital planning in assigned area(s). Initiate and implement engineering projects Manage calibration strategy, assessment and PM Optimization Support plant testing, commissioning and qualification activities Owns instrument loop diagrams, electrical equipment technical specifications, power & control plans Perform functional equivalency assessments Performs Asset Criticality Assessment Provide technical expertise in identifying complex issues, participate in root cause analysis and close out of corrective and preventive actions Provide technical review in creation and revision of Preventive Maintenance Plans (SOPs) and Job Aids/Visual Aids Regularly review and revise maintenance program and procedures to increase equipment reliability and reduce wastes of instrumentation and electrical installations including high tension and low tension systems Reviews submission for CMMS/CCMS Asset Induction and decommissioning (Asset Master data) Support Audits Support Investigations Technical review of instrumentation and electrical installation design To represent Site Engineering and the plant in all internal and external audits To provide technical support within Engineering and other departments in the planning and execution of projects Trend analysis (Corrective maintenance) and identify Bad Actors Possess front end technical knowledge in relevant areas such as electrical and controls engineering in relation to manufacturing systems as well as biopharmaceutical’s regulatory requirements. Responsibility to adhere to any applicable EHS requirements. Commitment to a fair and respectful relationship to others and behavior in accordance with company’s Code of Conduct. Any other duties as assigned by supervisor.
job_requirements: RequirementsKey Skills and Competencies  Excellent Communication Skills  Ability to effectively communicate via writing and oral communication at all levels. Express ideas effectively in individual and group situations (including non-verbal communication). Ability to communicate to internal and external personnel and to communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical people. Ability and willingness to express opinions and argue their basis.  Technical Knowledge  A good understanding of design principles and standards within the biopharmaceutical facilities. Ability to look at plant problems and come up with options for solutions. Ability to understand and challenge design and execution concepts from outside vendors/engineers.  Judging/Problem Solving  Ability to develop alternative courses of action that are based on logical assumptions, factual data and engineering principles. The alternate actions take into consideration resources (financial and manpower), constraints and organizational priorities.   Provides solutions to a wide range of difficult problems; solutions are imaginative, thorough and practicable. • Gain approval for recommended solution and implement through proper channels.  Quality/Attention to Details  Ability to accomplish tasks through concern for all areas involved. Demonstrating the proper level of detail for all aspects of the job; accurately checking processes, data and tasks; and maintaining attention over a period of time.  Teamwork/Collaboration  Ability to work effectively with internal and external teams or those outside formal line of authority (e.g. peers, senior managers) to accomplish goals. Take actions that respect the needs and contributions of others; contributing to and accepting the consensus; subordinating own objectives to the objectives of the project team. Represents the organization in providing solutions to difficult technical problems; frequent inter-organizational and global contacts.  Initiative  Ability to make active attempts to influence events to meet the goals of the project or organization. Given very general direction, independently determines and develops an approach to problem solving or project execution. Reviews work in terms of meeting project and organizational objectives Willing to be scheduled for call-outs during non-office hours to support manufacturing emergencies

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Medical Technologist will perform a wide variety of routine and complex clinical testing procedures to obtain data for use in clinical/anatomic trials research.
job_requirements: RequirementsRESPONSIBILITIES     Perform routine and complex analysis of patient specimens according to standard operating procedures (SOPs). Evaluate specimen acceptability upon receipt and during the review of analysis results. Evaluate validity of specimen results against the algorithms displayed by the lab computer system. Document all corrective actions taken. Perform secondary review of patient results when required to ensure accuracy of primary result entry. Provide oversight and guidance to Medical/Histo Laboratory Technicians and/or Assistants. Maintain quality control of all laboratory testing to ensure accurate and timely lab reporting. Perform pending workload review periodically during the day; find pending assays and resolve outstanding work prior to the completion of testing for the day. Assist in the development and writing of new Medical/Histo laboratory procedures and techniques. Follow safety procedures as per laboratory SOPs. Notify appropriate staff of supply shortages. Participate in continuing education through self-study, attending in-services and off-site lectures and meetings.

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities COMPANY DESCRIPTION  NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives.  RESPONSIBILITIES  We are looking for a result oriented SugarCRM professional who will be responsible for development, deployment and integration of SugarCRM Applications.  Your responsibilities include:  Analysing requirements, design and develop solutions in the SugarCRM framework, provide inputs for defining technical architecture of projects and support business applications. Perform Code reviews, handle deployment, continuously improve the deployment process,Troubleshoot, optimize to improve performance. Prepare Technical Design documents and implement the same. Prepare Unit Test cases, execute and prepare Unit Test reports. Perform data migration from other CRM software.

Should have at least 2 SugarCRM Implementations and have exposure to API level integration to other systems Strong knowledge of PHP, various web frameworks and MySQL, Code Igniter which includes writing high performance queries, DB tuning and administration. Experience in Client-side technologies, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, JSON, bootstrap etc. Should have excellent database design, querying and implementation skills. Solid Work experience of Object-Oriented Development and MVC Design.  Experience and knowledge of data migration and Talend tool (ETL) Working knowledge of Git/ Bitbucket integration and version control. Experience in creating and consuming RESTful APIs Strong Analytical skills and problem solver

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Accountant reports to the Finance Manager (FM) of the organisation. He/She is involved in most, if not all aspects of accounting and oversees the day-to-day activities of the accounting team. He/She ensures that the organisation's finance function is well organised as well as producing timely and accurate financial statements and management accounts, thus achieving compliance with corporate policies and statutory requirements. He/She analyses data and understands the financial performance and position of the organisation in order to develop suitable accounting policies to meet reporting requirements and to produce any special reports required by the management team.  The Accountant's role often involves leading a team of finance and accounting specialists and working closely with the internal and external auditors, bankers, and regulators. He/She must keep current with changing statutory requirements and tax laws and determine the implications of such changes to financial reporting. He/She may also work with the FM or the leadership team to help define the organisation's overall finance strategy.
job_requirements: Requirements~ Prepare accurate and timely financial statements.  ~ Calculate taxable income and the income tax liabilities of the organisation.  ~ Calculate the cost of different types of capital financial instruments and the overall costs of capital for the organisation.  ~ Compile accurate tax-related information for the organisation.  ~ Compute the valuation of business and financial assets using different models.  ~ Ensure the respective privileges and rights are in place within the accounting information system for users with different job roles and functions.  ~ Extract data and provide analysis for management using relevant accounting information systems or software.  ~ Implement policies and procedures with emphasis on internal controls to prevent possible fraud and errors.  ~ Maintain accurate journal entries and allocations.  ~ Manage accounts payable and receivables to help the organisation determine working capital needs and funding strategies.  ~ Operate accounting information systems efficiently and effectively.  ~ Participate in budgeting and forecasting activities.  ~ Plan and coordinate the annual financial audit process.  ~ Prepare asset, liability, and capital account entries by compiling and analysing account information.  ~ Prepare financial statements and disclosure notes.  ~ Provide accurate and timely tax and financial reports to the relevant authorities.  ~ Provide data in relation to assets, capital rationing and cost of capital.  ~ Reconcile accounts and provide analysis for the organisations financial transactions.  ~ Resolve issues and deficiencies arising from audit findings.  ~ Respond to internal and external auditors on audit data, variances and audit findings.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe candidate will be required to manage the data centre infrastructure, comprising the following main systems and components. Backup administration: Daily backup monitoring and on demand ad-hoc restoration as and when required. Creation of backup policies for new hosts as well as updates to existing policies as and when required. Automation of system provisioning: Includes powershell scripting for job automation, such as scripts for automatic VM provisioning.  Support Java Web applications for Oracle Weblogic.

Microsoft Windows Client and Server Technology: Familiar with Virtual Machine provisioning with System Center Virtual Machine Manager and other related tools. ii. Enterprise Backup Administration: Competent in the area of Veritas NetBackup (7.0 and above). iii. Enterprise Storage Administration: Familiar with various SAN storage provisioning and SAN switches administration (such as Brocade and CISCO). iv. Good team player, responsible and conscientious. Resourceful, independent, responsive and pro-active. Good understanding or experience in supporting Java Web Application for Oracle Weblogic is required

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Accountant reports to the Finance Manager (FM) of the organisation. He/She is involved in most, if not all aspects of accounting and oversees the day-to-day activities of the accounting team. He/She ensures that the organisation's finance function is well organised as well as producing timely and accurate financial statements and management accounts, thus achieving compliance with corporate policies and statutory requirements. He/She analyses data and understands the financial performance and position of the organisation in order to develop suitable accounting policies to meet reporting requirements and to produce any special reports required by the management team.  The Accountant's role often involves leading a team of finance and accounting specialists and working closely with the internal and external auditors, bankers, and regulators. He/She must keep current with changing statutory requirements and tax laws and determine the implications of such changes to financial reporting. He/She may also work with the FM or the leadership team to help define the organisation's overall finance strategy.
job_requirements: Requirements~ Prepare accurate and timely financial statements. ~ Calculate taxable income and the income tax liabilities of the organisation. ~ Calculate the cost of different types of capital financial instruments and the overall costs of capital for the organisation. ~ Compile accurate tax-related information for the organisation. ~ Ensure the respective privileges and rights are in place within the accounting information system for users with different job roles and functions. ~ Extract data and provide analysis for management using relevant accounting information systems or software. ~ Implement policies and procedures with emphasis on internal controls to prevent possible fraud and errors. ~ Maintain accurate journal entries and allocations. ~ Manage accounts payable and receivables to help the organisation determine working capital needs and funding strategies. ~ Operate accounting information systems efficiently and effectively. ~ Participate in budgeting and forecasting activities. ~ Plan and coordinate the annual financial audit process. ~ Prepare financial statements and disclosure notes. ~ Provide accurate and timely tax and financial reports to the relevant authorities. ~ Resolve issues and deficiencies arising from audit findings. ~ Respond to internal and external auditors on audit data, variances and audit findings.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com. J.P. Morgan is a place for talented people from all backgrounds and perspectives because our clients come from all backgrounds and perspectives. We encourage a culture of inclusion, where everyone's opinion counts and all employees have the freedom to deliver their absolute best. This is why we work hard and invest in attracting and developing a diverse workforce. Learn more about our Business Resource Groups in how they help our employees build successful careers and reach their greatest potential. Working in Cybersecurity takes pure passion for technology, speed, a constant desire to learn, and above all, vigilance in keeping every last asset safe and sound. You’ll be on the front lines of innovation, working with a highly-motivated team laser-focused on analyzing, designing, developing and delivering solutions built to stop adversaries and strengthen our operations. Your research and work will ensure stability, capacity and resiliency of our products and emerging industry trends. Working in tandem with your internal team, as well as technologists and innovators across our global network, your ability to identify threats, provide intelligent analysis and positive actions will stop adversaries and strengthen our data.
job_requirements: RequirementsThis role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:  Knowledge of Cybersecurity organization practices, operations, risk management processes, principles, architectural requirements, engineering and threats and vulnerabilities, including incident response methodologies Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals Proficiency in the use of skills tools, staying current with skills, participating in multiple forums Experience with Agile and can work with at least one of the common frameworks is highly desired. Ability to analyze vulnerabilities, threats, designs, procedures and architectural design, producing reports and sharing intelligence  This role:  Focus on the engineering, development and customization of a large Apache Nifi infrastructure that is core to the company’s capabilities to manage and transport critical data Architecture and development of large scale solution (big data) to be used in a very large production environment System, network and application troubleshooting Provide engineering support for Apache Nifi    Skills required:  Strong research, analytical and problem solving skills Independent problem-solving, highly motivated and self-directing Ability to write and debug administrative and reporting tools in some programming languages (Shell/Perl or Python,  Scala/Java/R, C/C++,  HTML5, or other experiences acceptable) Comfortable with most aspect of operating system administration such as tweaking, hardening and configuring services A robust understanding of Apache Nifi and its internals A solid understanding of Unix-based operating systems, including paging/swapping, IPC, drivers and filesystem (inode, partitions, etc.) Experience with host and network security (identity/password management, ACLs, file permissions and integrity) Strong interpersonal and communication skills; capable of writing documentation, training users in complex topics, making presentations to  junior and very senior audience Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment while remaining productive and professional; exercise patience and ability to multi task    Skills desired Having skills in the below areas is a major plus that will help the candidate integrate within the team and environment but is *not a requirement*.  Experience with hadoop ecosystem: Hadoop, Spark, Map/Reduce, Hive/Pig, Impala/Drill, etc. Experience with Data Science:  MLlib, Scikit, h2o, TensorFlow, Caffe, Singa, etc. Experience with NoSQL stacks: Elasticsearch, MongoDB, etc. Experience with SIEM products: Qradar, Arcsight, Splunk, etc. Experience with messaging and data transport tools: Kafka, NiFi, LogStash, Syslog-ng, rsyslog, etc. Experience with Link Analysis tools and GraphDBs Experience with data visualization tools: Hue, Kibana, Qlikview, Tableau, etc. Knowledge in RIA: HTML5, node.js, bootstrap, angular, extJS, etc.  Your expertise in cyber, combined with your desire to provide innovative security services, will be an asset to our Cybersecurity team. Help deliver high-quality security solutions across all our lines of business around the world by creating, designing, implementing, and maintaining next-level technology. The work you’ll do is vital, as it will protect over $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits every day.  We strongly encourage all applicants to apply via our careers website where you are able join our Talent Network to receive customized vacancy notifications and ensure that your details are accessible by our global recruiting team - www.jpmorganchase.com/careers. A quick link to this particular job posting can be found in this URL: http://jobs.jpmorganchase.com/ListJobs/ByKeyword/180054108/ Please note that only short-listed candidates will be notified. We thank you for your interest and wish you all the best in your career. Yours Sincerely, Human Resources JPMorgan

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOverview PTS Consulting Group (PTS) is a world class IT Consulting and Project Management company, providing Consultancy, Managed Services and Resourcing solutions to the world's biggest names. We have delivered over 11,000 engagements across the Americas, EMEA and Asia-Pacific.   Our working environments are constantly evolving and technology is the element which is both driving and enabling this trend. As a multi-disciplinary consultancy PTS Consulting assists clients in achieving their business objectives and outcomes through the application of technology.   We are seeking an individual to provide CAD and Revit Models for the Structured Cabling System, AV Multi-Media and Physical Security Consultants service lines, and other disciplines within PTS.   Candidates will be passionate about the application of technology, possess understanding of IT infrastructure, data centre design and MEP.
job_requirements: RequirementsResponsibilities  Production of CAD and Revit models for Equipment Room designs, floor layouts, meeting room and control room designs, elevations, details and schematic drawings etc. in the preparation of strategies, specifications, and Invitations to Tender for Structured Cabling System, Physical Security, and AV/Multi-Media building reports Development and administration of drawing libraries and updating of drawings in line with current technologies Management and administration of drawing change control and drawing filing system Provide Senior Management with accurate and timely management information on workflow and workload Ensure that a project audit trail is maintained and PTS Companies’ integrity is maintained at all times Ensure that all work is carried out within the parameters of PTS Companies’ standards (Project Life Cycle, Change Management etc.), and in accordance with the Company's BS EN ISO 9001 procedures (training will be provided) Submission and retrieval of drawings and documents on a variety of client project document management systems Maintain cognisance of time allowances on projects and maintain commercial efficiency in drawing production Adhere to all stated company policies, including Health and Safety Contribute to the ongoing development and betterment of your team and PTS Companies corporately Ensure all time is accurately recorded and updated weekly in the PTS timesheet system  Characteristics & Skills  Good knowledge of relevant systems and associated technologies and methodologies Autodesk CAD and Revit BIM expertise Strong administration skills Excellent communication skills written and verbal Strong understanding of metric and imperial measurements/conversions (scaling)  Other Qualities  Self motivation Willingness to learn Of smart appearance Be able to offer better working practices and efficiencies Quality approach and attention to detail Workload and priority management Good team communication

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Prabhakar lab is looking for creative and highly motivated PhD students and Postdoctoral Fellows to lead mathematical analysis of epigenomics and single-cell transcriptomics datasets in the areas of cancer, synthetic biology and immune phenotypes. We are a well-supported lab (A*STAR; NIH/NIMH; NRF; NMRC; industry partners) with strong links to clinicians and a track record of combining cutting- edge computational and experimental approaches to infer gene regulatory mechanisms in development and disease (Li et al., Nat Genet 2017; Sun et al., Cell 2016; del Rosario et al., Nat Methods 2015; Kumar et al., Nat Biotechnol 2013). In addition to answering basic questions regarding molecular and cellular phenotypes, our current focus is on analyzing cohort-scale epigenomics and single-cell omics data to identify novel cell types, biomarkers and druggable pathways.
job_requirements: RequirementsCandidates should have a PhD degree in a quantitative field, strong mathematical intuition, a strong publication record (postdoctoral candidates), strong communication skills, the ability to design new methods and the ability to work closely with clinicians and experimental biologists. Expertise is required in at least some of the following: mathematics, statistics, machine learning, signal processing, next- gen sequence analysis. Programming experience is a must.   The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice.   * We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
job_title: Gis - Post Doctoral Fellows (Mathematical Analysis Of Epigenomes, Single Cell Transcriptomes)

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs one of the fastest growing e-commerce companies in Asia, RedMart offers an unparalleled startup experience. Our culture: entrepreneurial, fiercely intelligent, team oriented, deeply creative and whatever you add to it!  We’re fanatical about improving our customer experience and providing “wow” customer service. Visual Product Designers play a vital role inside our organisation in both Singapore and Bangalore.  You will be working with cross-functional teams in RedMart to showcase our brand, our products, and our awesome shopping experience. What do we look for in a candidate? You create beautiful and engaging interactive experiences that support product vision, brand, and business objectives across our ecosystem. Your portfolio demonstrates best-in-class craftsmanship, solved by the marriage of a good user experience and proper functionality. You apply strong conceptual thinking and expertise in areas of design such as typography, iconography, colour, space and texture to help our customers successfully navigate, use, and enjoy our products. You believe that every product is built to be part of a design system, made of reusable components and patterns to efficiently function within a platform. Your designs are clean, elegant, flexible, and scalable. You can simultaneously consider all states of a single element and all of the contexts where elements fit together. You set up the product team for success by defining our visual design language and helping guide its use across our ecosystem. You’re not afraid to design in the open. You should be very comfortable in showing incomplete work with the team. At RedMart, we share work-in-progress design solutions work regularly within the team. This ensures that you are always on-track and moving in the right direction. You’ve shipped products. You understand that every product, new or existing, is made through constant iteration, driven by data informing your decisions, insights and observations translating into meaningful action. You know how to inspire and collaborate with engineers to build products that have business impact without compromising on design integrity. You never stop learning. You are aware that this business requires constant self-learning. From design trends, to new software like Sketch or prototyping tools that is constantly changing. On a personal level, you are not afraid to unlearn existing behaviors to experiment on new ones. Bottom line, you are always looking for the possibility of being wrong and open towards doing the right thing.
job_requirements: RequirementsThe hygiene stuff: - Enjoy moving fast: we don't wait for things to happen in RedMart - Be able to design the fine-grained details of interactions as well as a broad, conceptual vision - Be able to effectively and concisely communicate ideas - Document and prototype designs to effectively to facilitate development - Stay abreast of trends in visual design and in the competitive landscape - Be familiar in designing for mobile and web - Be proficient in Sketch or Adobe Photoshop   Years of experience in Visual Design does not matter here, but we are looking for an individual that embodies the qualities above. As part of your application, we would like to see your online portfolio or PDF portfolio.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPurpose of the role: The Legal Engineering team lead the way in creating innovative solutions to help lawyers deliver services for the benefit of lawyers and clients alike. Good progress has been made with regard to SmartDelivery across all of the firm's UK offices. The firm is keen to invest in other regions to ensure that we utilise and build on the work that has already been undertaken in the UK and that we create solutions that are applicable globally and relevant to our global sectors. A key part of this role will be to raise the profile of SmartDelivery and work on projects that arise in the APAC region. Automating documents forms a significant part of the workload of the Legal Engineering team. However the team are also involved in process mapping, creating workflows, implementing on-line instruction systems and data extraction projects. There will be a strong emphasis on development of operational processes, procedures and documentation.  Increasingly the team are involved in client facing projects involving direct communications with clients alongside the work for our internal clients. A Document Automation Engineer would primarily automate documents. A Legal Engineer would undertake the wider workload of the team alongside automating documents. We would anticipate quick progression from Document Automation Engineer to Legal Engineer. There are clear opportunities for personal development and the flexibility for individuals to take responsibility (with support) for their own career path whether that be project management (of automation workflow and client bespoke projects), IT technical development, supervision and management opportunities and developing presenting and training skills. The individual would also be involved in delivering client facing extranet solutions. Main duties and responsibilities: The following are the main duties and responsibilities of the Legal Engineering team as a whole. The candidate would not be expected to undertake all of these on joining the team but would do so over time as they develop into the role and progress within the team. Full training will be provided.  Raising the profile of SmartDelivery including undertaking demos (internal and external), presenting at meetings and generally increase awareness of SmartDelivery within the APAC region. Liaising with the Managing Legal Engineer to allocate APAC knowledge engineering work within the team. Obtain an understanding of the local business culture and the needs of the APAC region in terms of SmartDelivery. Support client presentations and proposals, including providing text into bid documents and where appropriate providing demos on the ground, getting support from the UK team as necessary. Create extranet sites on the firm's extranet systems (currently Sharepoint Online and HighQ Collaboration). Train internal users and clients in how to use the SmartDelivery Systems (Precedents Express, Matter Management and extranets) including ensuring that best practice for administering those systems is followed. Create new user accounts, assisting with new site set-ups and answering queries on the use of SmartDelivery Systems. Using Document Automation software (i.e. Contract Express by Thomson Reuters), which allows automation in plain English and does not require the author to use computer coding languages, the candidate will scope, plan and produce online questionnaires for the users to complete in order to prepare a legal contract or suite of documents in the most efficient way possible. Using bespoke in-house software, the candidate will scope projects and take requirements from internal and external clients to design and build innovative end-to-end workflow systems. Assisting with projects such as software upgrades and rolling out new developments to the firm. Assuming ownership of various projects and initiatives as assigned by the Manager. Developing project plans and ensuring these are delivered on time. Fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing within the team. Keeping abreast of emerging document assembly technologies and languages, and their applicability/suitability to Pinsent Masons to enable the team and business to continue to move forward. Representing the Legal Engineering team at internal and, where necessary, external events to help raise the profile of the team. Designing and delivering training to staff at all levels and clients. Where asked to do so – deputising for the Managing Legal Engineer in their absence.  Travel to other Pinsent Masons offices will be required to meet with lawyers, knowledge management leaders and clients to discuss and scope their requirements.
job_requirements: RequirementsRelevant Experience: The successful candidate will be highly proficient in the use of IT and have an interest in developing their technical skills further. Candidates should also have a good knowledge of the current challenges facing the legal market. They will have a strong business and commercial acumen and exemplary customer service skills. Attention to detail and the ability to use logic to solve complex problems are important attributes. Candidates may hold a Law Degree and / or qualifications in information systems, computer science, mathematics or similar disciplines. Alternatively, candidates with relevant experience gained within a law firm should also apply.  Previous experience of document assembly software (particularly Contract Express, Thomson Reuters) and a basic knowledge of HTML are desirable as is fluency in languages spoken in any of our international offices. Experience of SharePoint, Sharepoint Online, and HighQ Collaboration is desirable. The role is suitable for those who are looking for an alternative career path within the legal sector. We are seeking a motivated individual who is keen to develop their skills within a renowned team. Key Skills:  Highly proficient in use of IT (particularly Word and Excel). An innate ability to think logically. Excellent understanding of the importance of internal communications and knowledge sharing. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, capable of establishing immediate rapport. Capable of working autonomously but also operating within a team environment. Proven organisational skills. Ability to lead and deliver presentations and training to groups of people, including senior members of the firm. Ability to work accurately to tight deadlines, and to prioritise between conflicting demands. Ability to understand and take complex design briefs from an end user.  Personal Qualities / Behaviours  Proactive, with a keen eye for detail. Flexible in both attitude and in daily hours of work. Highly motivated with a can-do approach towards all given tasks. Understanding of privacy and confidentiality. Excellent interpersonal skills, including ability to develop effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Self starter and able to work on own initiative. A creative thinker with the ability to produce new ideas and concepts. Exhibits approach and behaviours consistent with the firm's core values.
job_title: Document Automation Engineer  /  Legal Engineer  /  Systems Engineer

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAt Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history in Singapore.     The Senior Finance Analyst  will be primarily responsible for business partnering, business planning, forecasting activities and expansion activities. This person will partner multiple stakeholders to provide timely analysis, insightful guidance, and financial leadership to this high-growth business.   This role requires extensive cross-functional partnership with various retail, operations, transportation, and central product teams. The manager will also lead variance analysis for monthly and quarterly business reviews as well as execute ad-hoc projects and analysis as needed.   The ideal candidate should also be interested in day to day finance tasks such as reporting and data analysis, and to ensure the successful running of the global transportation finance function.   The Senior Finance  Analyst will also lead the annual financial planning processes, ensuring effective and timely communication and coordination with central resources with the respective execution and expansion goals The role is located in Singapore and reports into the Finance Manager
job_requirements: RequirementsCreate financial models/sensitivities for future expansion models    Support the execution of key financial targets and metrics through the development and implementation of proactive dashboards, measurements and variance analyses  Support the integration of new consumer programs which improve customer experience and financial performance  Coordinating and drafting relevant narratives for Operating Plans and other identified initiatives  Build and maintain high level knowledge across all business areas by staying current on initiatives, challenges/opportunities .

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWHAT WE DO Niometrics’ Marketing team unites solutions experts, marketing scientists, design strategists, brand champions and corporate development specialists who strive to deliver value and make an impact. From creating new solutions and design strategy that enhance our users’ experience, taking the Niometrics brand to the next level, and giving everyone lines on the road, we do it all. Together, we define how digital data can be used to solve business challenges and serve the good of societies, and we shape the perception of Niometrics around the globe. The Marketing Communications team discovers what is best and most important about Niometrics, and it is our role to open it up to the world. We lead the creative direction of the Niometrics brand and we collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to communicate our messages with ingenuity and impact to our clients, partners, talents, and the broader community. Guardians of the brand identity and messaging, our mission is to elevate the Niometrics brand globally. We are a creative, highly collaborative, results-driven team. We are looking for the type of people who strive for excellence, paying attention to even the smallest details, without losing sight of the big picture. We value progressive thinkers, “can do” people who focus on getting things done and see challenges as an opportunity to make a difference.   YOUR ROLE AS VISUAL CONTENT CREATOR As Visual Content Creator, you will work closely with the Marketing Communications Manager to further develop the Niometrics brand visual identity and apply our brand essence consistently and creatively in all ways and across all touch-points. Creative responsibilities include conceiving, designing and developing graphic assets and creative materials that will drive, elevate and evolve the Niometrics brand. You will also be responsible for the development and execution of still photography and videography assets, driving productions projects end-to-end from conceptualisation, production, shooting and editing. When working with external parties, you will own the creative briefs and partner with the agency’s team to produce inspiring, groundbreaking creative work. Organisation, prioritisation and close attention to details is a must if you want to thrive in this role. You will manage multiple briefs at a time and you will be expected to deliver high quality outputs even under pressure. You will need to continually self-upgrade to find innovative and efficient ways to deliver compelling creative work, no matter the nature of the project.
job_requirements: RequirementsWHAT WE VALUE  Degree or relevant qualification in graphic design, visual communications, film, multimedia or related discipline, or equivalent practical experience 5-6 years of experience in a creative position for an agency or within an in-house marketing/brand team Knowledge of video and photo equipment, and videography, video editing, photography, photo editing and general graphic design skills is a must Proficiency in design tools and video/stills post tools, including but not limited to Adobe CS, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Flash, Light Room, and Apple iWork Suite Competence in print design, understanding of the printing process and specifications, and familiarity with production and rendering methods Portfolio available for review

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWHAT WE DO Niometrics captures, organises and extracts insights from some of the biggest and most complicated datasets that our modern societies currently produce. We put a magnifying glass on the realities collectively constructed by billions of connected individuals and machines, making sense of how humanity is re-creating wholly new digital universes with bits and bytes – universes that need to be seen, interpreted and explained. From taking deep dives into digital behaviours, to exploring the most intimate interactions between network technology and user experiences, we do it all. Our UX/UI team works very closely with Product Owners in their tireless quest to create actionable insights out of seemingly disjointed datasets. We may, for example, design interfaces to show how hundreds of millions of digital users cluster into micro-segments, how they move about on their daily lives or what their next predicted actions will be. And we do all that while applying a relentless attention to detail, building interfaces that are as pleasurable to consume as they are intuitive to understand. We believe that, if data is the new oil, then visualisations are the new rigs, extracting real value out of massive information pools and conveying the ‘so-whats’ that really matter.   YOUR ROLE AS UX/UI DESIGNER As a UX/UI Designer, you will create web-based user interfaces that convert analytical complexity into visible, intuitive, easy-to-grasp insights. You will do this by conceptualising products from start to end. These concepts are typically articulated through wireframes, mockups and prototypes that translate Product Owners’ ambitions into tangible designs that steer the work of the developer team.
job_requirements: RequirementsWHAT WE VALUE  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Web Design & Development, Human-Computer Interaction 2 - 4 years of experience in UI/UX, Web or Visual Design Portfolio available for review Advanced HTML and CSS experience

We lead the creative direction of the Niometrics brand and we collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to communicate our messages with ingenuity and impact to our clients, partners, talents, and the broader community. Guardians of the brand identity and messaging, our mission is to elevate the Niometrics brand globally. We are a creative, highly collaborative, results-driven team. We are looking for the type of people who strive for excellence, paying attention to even the smallest details, without losing sight of the big picture. We value progressive thinkers, “can do” people who focus on getting things done and see challenges as an opportunity to make a difference.   YOUR ROLE AS MARKETING COMMUNICATIONS EXECUTIVE As Marketing Communications Executive, you will work closely with the Marketing Communications Manager to contribute to the development and implementation of Niometrics’ global brand positioning and messaging strategies and operational activities. You will drive and participate in various marketing communications projects — from defining and implementing digital marketing strategies with our partner agencies, to organising and managing events worldwide, up to the development and production of our branded corporate materials and corporate gifts, you will do it all. You will need to collaborate closely with cross-functional teams internally, and develop and maintain external vendor relationships. Organisation, prioritisation, and careful planning is a must if you want to thrive in this role. You will be working on several projects at once, while remaining on schedule and within budget, and you will be expected to deliver high quality outputs even under pressure.
job_requirements: RequirementsWHAT WE VALUE  Bachelor’s or master’s degree in marketing, communication, business or related discipline, or equivalent practical experience 2 years of relevant experience in marketing communications or similar Experience in digital marketing and/or marketing project management is a plus Dynamic, independent, resourceful individual with good time management and good problem solving skills Team player with excellent communications and interpersonal skills

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany Overview Intellect Minds is a Singapore-based company since 2008, specializing in talent acquisition, application development, and training. We serve BIG MNCs and well-known clients in talent acquisition, application development, and training needs for Singapore, Malaysia, Brunei, Vietnam and Thailand. Our client is an establish company a, leader within their industry, is now looking for a Application Support Engineer to join their esteemed organization. Job Descriptions: • As the Application Support Engineer, your responsibilities will be running Java and NodeJS based projects in production and non-production environments • Understand product business processes and assist internal and external stakeholders on technical, functional and data related issues • Perform sanity testing based on various test plan and create the documentation of the test result • Responsibilities could also need to analyze incident, find out the root cause, and provide workaround plan  • Involve in application testing (unit code testing, SIT and UAT), involve in source code improvement, new enhancement and technology upgrade
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements: • Good knowledge in Unix commands and scripting • Good knowledge in running application servers like Tomcat, Spring Boot etc., • Experience in running and maintaining applications in production • Knowledge of software engineering basics, at least one programming language and OS, knowledge of DBMS • Good analytical abilities and logical thinking • Have good communication skills and able to communicate to cross-functional teams   • Ability to learn new technologies quickly and conform to standards Technical Skills: • At least 2-4 years years relevant working experience in software development and implementation. • Proven track records in Linux commands, Tomcat Server, (Oracle PL/SQL) and Oracle Database. • Proven track records in Java, J2EE (JSP, JDBC etc.), Spring, Hibernate. • Good debugging and troubleshooting skills. • Fast learner and keen to take ownership of the tasks. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness Function  Risk Management Group (RMG) is responsible for the development and maintenance of risk management and internal control frameworks. We provide independent review and challenge to business to ensure that appropriate balance is considered in risk/return decisions. In addition, RMG is responsible for the monitoring and reporting on key risk issues of the Bank. To manage risk effectively and deliver strong financial performance, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure. Responsibilities  The role will be responsible for managing the end-to-end validation process for the BCBS 239 (Basel’s Principles for effective risk data aggregation and risk reporting) compliance validation programme.  Design the validation testing processes and procedures for BCBS 239 compliance validation  Lead validation testing activities and manage the validation workflow Form an overall view of the Bank’s compliance with BCBS 239  Compliance Validation  Ensure effective implementation of BCBS 239 validation testing and procedures and ensure their alignment with the compliance validation methodology Develop the repository of validation test questions covering all aspects of BCBS 239 Coordinate the performance of validation testing activities on various units being validated Assess, review and challenge materials submitted by the various units being validated Evaluate evidence and form an overall view of the Bank’s compliance with BCBS 239 principles Guide discussions with key stakeholders to ensure a collaborative approach to agreeing on the validation outcomes   Reporting and Monitoring  Monitor and report the Bank’s status of compliance with BCBS 239 and implementation status of remediation actions, including the aging of actions Oversee the implementation of remediation plans and outcomes; and the associated actions Share with working groups relevant best practices of processes, and challenge existing processes Review validation reports Prepare draft status reports of compliance to the Board, Senior Management and/or regulators Act as the deputy for the Head of Compliance Validation, where appropriate
job_requirements: Requirements A degree holder with minimum 5 years’ working experience in a role within risk management, audit or compliance Adequate understanding of regulatory environment in banking  Experience and good understanding of data management principles, including controls and governance (preferred) Fluent in written and spoken English Good analytical skills and sound judgment Strong problem-solving skills and ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks  Knowledge of banking, policies, processes, controls and systems Team player with good inter-personal and communication skills, and the ability to work with multiple cross-functional stakeholders
job_title: Vp / Avp, Compliance Validation, Risk Management Group (1800046U)

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesFounded in 2016, the Company's team of data scientists and technologists came together with one mission; to solve healthcare problems and advance humankind through the ethical and responsible use of data. By creating the most advanced artificial intelligence capable of making accurate predictions years into the future, the Company aims to apply its predictive engine to all aspects of the healthcare industry, to help patients, providers, caregivers and payers manage patients throughout the lifecycle of their diseases at lower costs. We are looking for a highly motivated, driven and sales powerhouse to evangelize our product to the industry.  If this describes you, we should meet!  A Leader - You are a dynamic, self-motivated, creative thinker, with an appreciation of our corporate vision and goals. A Driver - You have a passion for success and are always trying to perfect your craft. You do not stop until you reach or exceed your goals. A Collaborator - You are willing and able to work across teams in a matrix environment where you share your strengths and ideas with others. A Hunter & Closer - We arm you with the tools, support and resources so that you can focus on successfully generating new revenue, building strong relationships and achieving goals. This is a sales, true “hunter” and “closer” role with big rewards and a highly competitive compensation package. 	Key responsibilities   Prospecting: Building your book of business through existing network, cold calling, emails, leads, trade shows and conferences, partnership referrals and more  Producing: Maintain high activity levels every week to achieve all goals Selling: You will effectively manage and execute on the full sales cycle of our solutions: Gaining Access, Qualifying, Discovery, Alignment, Presentation, Demo, Proposal, Negotiation, Closing Executing: Meeting or exceeding all strategic, quarterly and annual sales goals Building: Continue developing and maintaining industry knowledge and building successful sales techniques to ensure goals are achieved Communicating:  Interfacing effectively with external and internal clients and teams. You will be interacting and communicating with both external and internal prospects, clients, partners and team members  Remuneration   During the first six-month of service, you will be on a commission-only structure with no basic salary. You will be remunerated purely based on your individual sales performance at a significantly higher than market commission rate. Thereafter, your remuneration will convert to a monthly basic salary plus commission structure. Your monthly basic pay will be computed based on your first year of sales performance.
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements and qualifications  Proven and consistent track record of achieving monthly, quarterly, and annual sales goals in an enterprise or technical software solution sales environment within either the hospitals, pharmaceutical or insurance sector. Deep rolodex within the hospitals, pharmaceutical or insurance sector. Strong communication, presentation and negotiation skills required.
