job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout the Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore’s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg Successful candidate will apply machine learning algorithms to develop an evaluation framework that will support a conversational A1 spoken dialogue system for studentsto assess how well they can speak a foreign language. Successful candidate will also develop solid engineering skills in deploying application systems and applied research experience of processing low-resource spoken languages, using techniques such as deep learning, transfer learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, domain and speaker adaptation, and GANs.
job_requirements: Requirements Minimum Bachelor in Engineering Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning with solid R&D experience or knowhow  Proficient in Python/Matlab/C++ programming   Knowledge in Deep Learning   The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.  In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.  As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.
job_requirements: Requirements ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesABOUT UNILEVER INTERNATIONAL: Unilever International (UI) is an alternative but complimentary route to market, servicing white space opportunities not exploited by local operating countries.  It is a global business unit with 9 hubs (Singapore, US, UK, Korea, India, Dubai, France, the Philippines and Australia) with a diverse range of products, with expertise in utilizing 3rd party distributors and consolidators to reach consumers in over 75 countries. UI have been operating successfully as an alternate Route to Market (RtM) to complement Multi-Country Organizations (MCOs) to serve these white spaces through a network of 500+ market expansion service providers and specialists via seeding initiatives. The market expansion providers or distributors in countries provide brand building and customer development services to UI under the agreed operating frameworks using the brand toolkits provided. UI have strategically evolved its portfolio from availability led growth to seeding in the last 5 years.  JOB TITLE: Assistant Finance Manager, Performance Management & Reporting JOB LOCATION: Singapore RELOCATION TERMS: Local terms  MAIN PURPOSE OF THE JOB: This role will also be involved in performance management and reporting. There will be an emphasis upon information management, process simplification and automation where possible, allowing way of workings driven commonly with faster speed among all the hubs.  The role needs to actively coordinate with the appropriate Unilever stakeholders to ensure a globally harmonized management reporting process for UI.  MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES: Performance Management and Reporting  Develop close working relationships with senior stakeholders globally to ensure alignment of monthly forecast for various business units (BU) within UI and ensuring accurate delivery of monthly financial forecast; Be the contact point for UI to help interface with global finance on reporting of results, ensuring timely and accurate submissions; Set up reporting units to enable seamless data flow through transactional system (ERP), data warehouse and Unilever reporting system; Assists with information management, process simplification and automation; Initiates continuous improvement for efficiently reporting purpose.  Analytics  Support the development of various performance measures targets; Analysis, insight and control over targets and actual performance measures; Assist in the work on strengthening of process for Information Analytics.  Others   Any other ad-hoc tasks required by the business.
job_requirements: RequirementsRELEVANT SKILL/ EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Experience & Personal Characteristics Responsible for both financial analysis and business performance, the candidate must possess both strong quantitative abilities and excellent written and oral communication skills. They are strategic, analytical thinkers who are driven by results and can innovate and develop creative financial solutions. The candidate must have the necessary accounting qualifications (CPA/ACCA and/or past exposure to financial audit role is preferred) and is expected to have 5 years+ of holistic experience in different aspects of Finance and Accounting; Performance Management. Passion to learn and make a difference.  The candidate has high levels of self-assurance and shows resilience and belief in own ability to achieve goals. The individual will need to be a relationship builder and able to get things done independently. Must have a high level of integrity supported by strong interpersonal skills, good maturity and ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization will be critical to the success of this role.  Lastly being part of the UI family, the candidate must be able to thrive in a fast paced and highly dynamic environment and navigate through complexities to arrive at solutions. He/she is expected to demonstrate the following leadership behaviors:  Strategic, Systemic Thinking & Entrepreneurial High Growth mind-set & Consumer/Shopper and Customer focus UL SOLs: Building talent and teams, Bias for action and change, Accountability and responsibility  Strong Communication & Influencing skills  Critical Competencies  Working knowledge of SAP or other similar accounting software systems Experience dealing with multiple currencies and exchange rates preferred Strong analytical and writing skills Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office software Ability to build effective working relationships and communicate at all levels within the organization    TO APPLY:  Please apply online by clicking on “Apply Online” below. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements. Should you not meet our immediate requirements, your profile will be registered in our talent pool system and we will match your profile to suitable future vacancies.  You will be able to access your status update through the candidate tracking link.  Thank you for your interest and application.  *We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified. Want to join our Talent Community? Please register your details here: http://unilever.avature.net/madebyyou?tags=singtc

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities Main con Attractive salary that commensurate with work experience Opportunities for career advancement within the company  The BIM Manager will lead a BIM team of BIM Coordinators and Modellers for all disciplines from Design to Construction stage. A summary of the responsibilities of this position are, and not limited to, as follows:  Lead in BIM implementation, Standards, Modelling workflow & methodologies. Liaise with Project Manager on BIM/VDC implementation based on Project Needs and Requirement. Prepare, execute and maintain the BIM Execution Plan (BEP). Ongoing review of BIM Project Models, workflows and methodologies to ensure timely delivery of project deliverables. Creating and maintaining a high quality BIM model is of priority. Technical management of project BIM data sets. Liaise with team to ensure changes in procedure and standards are effectively communicated to project teams. Liaise and coordinate with client, consultants, sub-con and statutory bodies for cross-team support on BIM software.   Ensure all models are compatible and BIM data are made available to all project participants. Collaborate with team and other relevant departments to ensure all drawings are in order as per design requirements.   Support Project Team in managing RFI as well as making presentations with BIM Model & other related activities. Familiar with Authority submission standards.
job_requirements: RequirementsSkills  Strong interpersonal skill and ability to develop positive relations with different stakeholders. Able to lead and inspire high performance, to ensure all drawings are accurate and issued on a timely basis.  Technical Competencies  Understands specifications, drawings, scope and sequence of works. Ability to interpret construction drawings for any discrepancies. Coordination and identify areas of concerns with design intent. Understanding of architectural / structural / M&E drawings. Awareness of requirements of relevant authorities. Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree/Post Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in Engineering (Civil), Architecture or equivalent. At least 6 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Trained in BIM, preferably with at least 2 years of BIM coordination or BIM management. Advanced knowledge in latest technology for 4D-7D BIM/VDC/VR/SIMULATIONS Required Skill(s): BIM, Revit, AECOsim Candidates please submit a full set of coordinated BIM model inclusive of architectural, structural and M&E disciplines in pdf format together with your CV.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesYoung and research-intensive, Nanyang Technological University (NTU Singapore) is ranked 11th globally. It is also among the world’s best young universities. With more than 400 partnerships with top academic institutions and industry leaders such as BMW and Rolls-Royce, NTU is ranked No. 1 globally for industry income and innovation. It is also No. 1 among top Asian universities in terms of normalised research citation impact (Thomson Reuters’s InCites 2012). The School of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering (MAE) is ranked 11th in the world and 1st in Singapore (QS Subject ranking 2017). With well-established industry partnerships with prominent companies such as Rolls-Royce, General Electric, Pratt & Whitney and Singapore Airlines, MAE provides an active and vibrant research environment with excellent R&D infrastructure and numerous opportunities for research funding. The school has an enrolment of over 2500 undergraduate students with over 110 faculty members and 140 full-time research staff working in well-equipped state-of-the-art laboratories. A growing research student population of over 400 is also actively engaged in strategic research and development work. You will be expected to support the Chair in execution and implementation of school’s Strategic work plan by facilitating discussions with various stakeholders and departments to ensure timeline completion of deliverables in order to meet Strategic objectives. .  Job Responsibilities:  Strategic Work Plan and Project Initiatives  Coordinate with respective teams and seek improvement towards alignment across all functions and work hand in hand with functions within the Chair’s Office (Academic, Faculty, Research, Students) as well as College of Engineering through interactions as set out below:  Partner with associated offices to draw up the Strategic work plan, ensure its completeness and track its implementation Maintain effective networks, enhance relationships, and advocate with key government figures, regulators, industry partners and community interest groups to project a positive image for the school.  Develop, direct and control the strategic and operational planning frameworks and planning outcomes for the school in the short, medium and long term and assist the Chair in executing the Strategic work plan Review draft evaluation reports after a detailed review of the internal environment, in preparation for further discussion with the management Engage relevant functions in overseeing and ensuring seamless implementation of the improvement plans/initiatives Drive new strategic initiatives through setting up and stewardship of meetings, formulation of work groups/committees, workshops and/or other equivalent platforms that may be necessary to expedite completion of deliverables    Academic and Industry Engagement  Drive the school’s engagement efforts, working closely with the Chair and school faculty to plan and develop initiatives to help build a positive image for the school Gather intelligence on the industrial landscape, research and translate future business trends into R&D opportunities for the school Plan and organize events (talks, visits etc) for the school’s academic and industry partners Help develop new partnerships and maintain existing relationships for the school Initiate, develop, and maintain productive working relationships with high-prospect academic and industry partners for School engagement. Responsible for achieving metrics for identifying, qualifying, and cultivating academic and industry prospects    Faculty Affairs and Administration Support  Provide secretarial support for all faculty search appointment/ re-appointment committees meetings, as required, including, but not limited to, arranging meetings, preparing agendas and meeting papers, taking minutes, following up on action points. Manage all aspects of candidate on-campus visits, academic presentations and meetings, and processing reimbursements. Compilations of academic profiles of prominent researchers from updated and accurate citation reports, CV documents and sufficient strong reference letters from external referees for the Chair’s office review. Compile and analyze data, and prepare reports required for the effective assessment of candidates for the respective committees’ appointment cases on a timely basis. Verification of the quantitative and qualitative contributions as provided by Faculty. To support compilation of data and preparation of reports for SMC    Other duties  Monitor, track and project the School/ Provost RSS to ensure proper allocation and utilization as well as advise the Chair on pending commitments  Collaborate with the GS unit to ensure that all RSS are properly utilized and any related issues are resolved. This includes assisting to resolve any potential issues faculty may encounter and matchmaking of potential student candidates to suitable supervisors. Serve as secretariat of the SMC and School Board meetings, providing insight when necessary. Draft reports, newsletters, speeches and presentation slides while ensuring a professional and positive image for the school
job_requirements: Requirements Preferably a Bachelor’s Degree from a recognized University At least 3 to 5 years of relevant working experience.  Excellent knowledge of the academia, research or computer science is advantageous.  Excellent command of English with excellent writing skills. Prolific minute-taker. Good in storytelling and development of creative presentations to sell ideas/concepts Research and data analysis skills, with strong interest in technology and good knowledge of the research landscape as well as understanding of industry needs Project Management experience and skills Strategic programmes development and planning experience Excellent interpersonal, analytical and problem solving skills Event planning management skills experience Ability to handle confidential information  Strong communication and interpersonal skills Strong analytical ability and highly attentive to details Highly resourceful, proactive and self-motivated, able to work with little to no resources available  Effective team player and an independent worker who thrives under challenging timelines and possesses the ability to improvise and adapt on the fly    Application Procedures: Interested applicants are to apply via the link below. https://ntu.taleo.net/careersection/jobdetail.ftl?job=180000G5&lang=en   We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Purpose  The School of Continuing and Lifelong Education (SCALE) was established to drive the expansion of NUS’ Continuing Education and Training (CET) offerings in a concerted and strategic way that furthers our mission to be a leading global university, as well as fulfill our role as a public university of Singapore.  SCALE aims to:  Provide opportunities for working adults to acquire new knowledge and skills from a distinguished university; Help Singapore companies and industries stay competitive by providing lifelong learning experiences for their employees; and Effectively support national manpower needs.  Drawing on unparalleled access to the multi-disciplinary expertise of 16 other NUS Faculties/Schools, SCALE offers executive and professional development/training programmes, part-time degree programmes, as well as modular courses that may be taken singly or stacked towards certificates/diplomas/degrees that meet the lifelong learning needs of working adults.  All programmes are designed and developed in consultation with the industry to ensure relevance and currency. To augment the manpower in our Academic Programme Support Unit, we are looking for a diligent and meticulous individual to fill the position of a Management Assistant Officer. Reporting to the Head (Programme/Student Administration), the incumbent is a member of the team that strives to provide our teaching staff and students with high quality administrative support to facilitate a seamless and efficient experience at SCALE. Duties & Responsibilities: A. Programme Support   Prepare data for module registration in each semester and assist in students’ registration   Collate semestral nomination of teaching/support personnel to run all academic programmes   Manage the scheduling and grouping of tutorial and laboratory sessions   Manage/monitor students’ registration, progress and completion of the Final Year Project module   Monitor students’ graduation or programme completion status   Assist in conducting  programme surveys and provide data preparation support in the Student Feedback System   Arrange for students who are academically at risk to attend advisory sessions with academic staff   Process students’ requests for examination review   Provide support to ensure the smooth execution of examinations    B. Customer Care Support    Attend to telephone, walk-in and email enquiries   C. Others    Backup other colleagues in the function   Perform other duties, and/or participate in regular and ad-hoc events/projects, as may be assigned
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements:   Polytechnic Diploma/GCE A-level or equivalent preferred   Preferably 1-2 years of related working experience   IT savvy and proficient in MS Office applications   Good verbal & written communication and interpersonal skills with a positive work attitude   Excellent coordination and organization skills, with a customer service mindset   Strong team player who is meticulous, resourceful, resilient and thrives in a fast-paced, results-oriented and ambiguous work environment   Experience in PeopleSoft Campus Solutions modules (in particular, Campus Community, Student Records, Student Financials, Campus Self-Service, Academic Advisement) an added advantage
job_title: Management Assistant Officer, Scale (Programme And Student Administration)

Support the Brand Marketing Plan development and deployment. Generate and execute marketing campaigns across social media platforms Generate reports for digital marketing campaigns using data-based analytics tools and also presenting this data in an easy to understand format Assist in the brand’s day to day operational activities including monitoring of brand performance on a monthly and quarterly basis. Source advertising opportunities and place adverts in the press, radio or TV as appropriate to the product or service Conduct market research and analyze consumer rating reports/ questionnaires Design and oversee ad layouts, bundle pack labels or designs Liaise with media, printers and publishers as required and manage the production of marketing materials Work with BTL vendors for effective and efficient deployment in close coordination with sales team and regulatory. Manage the nuts and bolts of commerce business – translations/ providing images/ deciding on promotions and managing mechanics. Prepare and deliver promotional presentations, Sales force training Write marketing literature (brochures, press releases) to augment the company’s presence in the market Be the single point source for all customer complaints.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are a team of creative and inspiring designers, developers, and strategic thinkers that partner with our deep analytics team, customer journey design team to focus on the business and employee experience implications of digital-first for our clients.   About the opportunity Digital API & Agile Transformation Consultants at EY Digital are the engine room of our business, working on the front lines with our client, colleagues and third-parties to execute the digital business vision. We work across industries and markets, cross-pollinating the best of digital, customer, strategy and technology to help our clients monetize data and design new services through API solutions, and help execute digital transformation through large scale agile methodologies and modern agile development platforms. And at the heart of it all, embed customer centric experience design in how we execute. Digital API & Agile Transformation Consultants embrace an achievement focused culture within EY, living EY’s core values, and positively influencing our culture more widely through the collaborative engagement of other internal teams to deliver leading practice digital strategy, innovation, customer experiences and digital operations.   Key Responsibilities:  Feel excited working with multiple parts of the businesses across multiple industries, solutioning and delivering complex digital solutions You find yourself always wanting to innovate and shape the industry, wanting to differentiate You have been known to be able to understand both sides of a coin, the business aspect and the technology aspect of things You believe that Design Thinking and is the way to go in everything that we do, and Agile Methodologies can be applied appropriately in how we execute
job_requirements: RequirementsSkills and Attributes for success  You always see yourself as someone who likes being near the businesses and is always passionate about looking for opportunities in turning day to day business challenges into digital solutions You enjoy communicating with people from various background and skill sets across an organisation, and has always been great at communicating an idea or POV across various channels and mediums    To qualify for the role, you must have:  Minimum of three years' experience as an internal or external consultant working on business transformation, product, operations and/or technology projects in a digital environment Experience of multi-channel digital environments having worked in professional services and/or customer focused companies Skilled in all aspects of Design Thinking including user research, functional requirements definition, business process analysis, business modelling, and workshop design and facilitation, or working knowledge of the full lifecycle of software development using Agile Methodologies Either strong Business Analysis experience or deep Technical expertise combined with strong knowledge of one or more of Digital/Ecommerce/Government/Financial Services/Consumer Products Detailed knowledge of creating user stories/requirements definition/acceptance criteria using agile tools and techniques Deep understanding of either API, Low Code Development platform, Chatbots or CRM B2B and B2C exposure      Ideally, you’ll also have  Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills Ability to work in a collaborative and client-facing environment Experience of working with or as part of a scrum team Advanced degrees relevant to digital delivery.    What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What working at EY offers  EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:    Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you      About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

This Android app developer will work with our team of talented engineers to design and build the next generation of our mobile applications. Design and build advanced applications for the Android platform   Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features   Work with outside data sources and APIs   Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability   Work on bug fixing and improving application performance   Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities A well-established US Manufacturing MNC.  Responsibilities:​  Responsible for the disposition of material according given demand in CIP’s (Continuous Improvement Project) andCSR's (Customer Specific Requirement), achieving lowest possible cost with shortest possible lead time, OTD (On Time Delivery) and up to our quality standards. Implement 6R of the Logistics -» Right Material, Right Price, Right Quality, Right Time, Right Place, Right Conditions.  Key Responsibilities: CIP & CSR  Disposing and ordering material for CIP's and CSR's according to demand in the ERP system (SAP). Work closely with local production planning. Work with the supplier to agree on corrective actions to resolve escalated issues (e.g. chasing supplier for OTD) or look for alternative suppliers when necessary. Request and analyze quotations. Negotiate prices based on open calculation, lead-time, landed cost and total cost. Issuing PO’s (Purchase Orders) related to quotations.  NPI’s  Support NPI (New Product Introduction), DAPI (DA Product Innovation) and LLI (Long Lead Item). Issuing QC’s (Quantity Contracts) and Call Offs related to QC's or PO's  (Purchase Orders) related to quotations. Work closely with Global Strategic Supply Management (support of supplier evaluation, phasing in new products, and in managing of demand request for Project-Material Orders) and Operational Purchasing in Asia (Malaysia and China).  Generic  Hand over engineering change requests to suppliers (close team work with Manufacturing Engineering). Prepare analysis and statistics to control and support the sourcing strategy and the strategic planning. Proactive improvement of the quality along the entire supply chain in close cooperation with all involved Departments (Product Group, Research & Development, Material Management, and Finance). Control and verify invoices with price deviations referring to PO. Make sure that all necessary purchasing parameters (vendor data, contracts) are given and stored properly and take appropriate actions whenever necessary. Improvement programs correspondingly. Monitor the supplier performance, conduct regular supplier assessments and audits, and prepare analysis.​
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements:  Degree in Mechanical Engineering. 5 years' experience in Global sourcing (Asia focused, Asian supply market knowledge). Experience in supplier qualifications, auditing and corrective action processes. Experience in SAP/R3. Excellent negotiation skills. Experience in execution of total daily business of material purchasing, establishment of timely availability of all orderedmaterials and services and optimization of material flow and of inventory level. Able to optimize the supplier relationship by combining supplier's and internal processes. Good understanding of the Supply Chain, the critical production and assembly processes.  Other Information:  Working Location: Science Park. Working Hours: Mondays to Fridays, 8.30am to 5.30pm.  To apply, please visit www.gmprecruit.com and search for Job Reference: 13860. To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Novita Tan at novita.adisutanto@gmprecruit.com We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesLooking to work with other driven programmers, engineers and designers on ground breaking medical technology? Skin cancer diagnosis is currently a slow, expensive and none-too-accurate process. Here at Iko, we have been working hard on our patent-pending imaging technology and are developing our platform to increase early cancer detection and save lives. We’re now looking for world-class talent to join our development team. Iko is a small, Singapore based startup with clinical trials taking place in some of the most prestigious facilities in the world. Our office is in a beautiful modern shophouse, accompanied by a variety of other startups under one umbrella company. Enjoy the closeness of a small startup team, with the vibrancy of a communal environment. As part of a small close-knit team, you’ll be working directly on core product development and will have direct impact on the success of our venture. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated developer to take charge of the development of our embedded device application software, running on the NVIDIA Jetson TX2 SoM. The role includes implementing the necessary algorithms for real-time data processing, user feedback and device control. We offer:  A supportive, informal environment of other experienced programmers, engineers and designers. Complex and meaningful work, with the opportunity to see for yourself how clinicians, patients and healthcare systems stand to benefit. Good monthly salary; performance-based annual bonus.
job_requirements: Requirements Qualifications in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent experience. Highly proficient in C++. Highly proficient in parallel computing with CUDA. Experience developing on the NVIDIA Tegra based SoC / SoM (NVIDIA Jetson) highly advantageous. Knowledge and experience in Computer Vision and 3D Graphics highly advantageous. Initiative and a strong sense of personal responsibility. Tenacity to solve hard and interesting problems. Able to work both independently and collaboratively. Strong troubleshooting, debugging and problem-solving skills.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesLooking to work with other driven programmers, engineers and designers on ground breaking medical technology? Skin cancer diagnosis is currently a slow, expensive and none-too-accurate process. Here at Iko, we have been working hard on our patent-pending imaging technology and are developing our platform to increase early cancer detection and save lives. We’re now looking for world-class talent to join our development team. Iko is a small, Singapore based startup with clinical trials taking place in some of the most prestigious facilities in the world. Our office is in a beautiful modern shophouse, accompanied by a variety of other startups under one umbrella company. Enjoy the closeness of a small startup team, with the vibrancy of a communal environment. As part of a small close-knit team, you’ll be working directly on core product development and will have direct impact on the success of our venture. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe School of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering (MAE) boasts comprehensive state-of-the-art facilities and a faculty comprising more than 130 professors, making it one of the largest mechanical engineering schools in the world. Faculty members are drawn from renowned universities worldwide, providing a wealth of collective expertise in traditional mechanical and aerospace engineering, and in specialities including manufacturing, mechatronics, innovative design, nanotechnology, and biomedical and computational applications.  The Additive Microstructure Engineering Laboratory (AddME Lab) at the Nanyang Technological University (NTU, Singapore) invites applications for a postdoctoral research position with focus on “Inferring grain boundary crystallography-property relations using high-throughput experiments”. The work will focus on assessing the property value of thousands of individual grain boundaries with known crystallography using our high-throughput experimental techniques. The large data set will be fed into neural-network-models to predict materials properties as a function of the grain boundary character distribution. Materials of interest will be polycrystalline metals and alloys for structural applications.
job_requirements: Requirements PhD degree in Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field Knowledge of polycrystalline metal and crystallography Knowledge of intergranular corrosion processes Expertise in microstructure characterization (e.g. metallography and EBSD)    We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesIn view of our new business strategies to venture into wider spectrum of industry coverage, a new business entity has been established to manage the new business portfolio. In order to be successful for the role, the incumbent will be entrusted with full responsible for the Profit/Loss accountability. Venture aggressive ly by developing the Singapore market and managing all aspects of sales, technical consultancy, project and all operational control of the business. Other aspect of core role responsibilities shall include but not limiting to the following: -  Maintain existing business accounts and continue to develop and build solid new business relationship with potential customers Work together with management to design and implement a strategic business plan that continue to expand customer base and its strong presence Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with the customers and exploring their needs Continue to research and identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of potential threats and competition status Review work processes and make recommendation for improvement to enhance themProvide coaching and development opportunity for staff under his/her charge creating such environment where employees is able to work towards achieving targets Analyze market trends and data and discover new opportunities for growth Suggest and propose new services and innovative sales avenue /techniques to increase customers' satisfaction Address potential problems and suggest promote /quick turnaround solution Facilitate input on recruitment campaign to recruit a robust team to build up the business Prepare and review annual budget for the area of responsibility  Other key focus areas: - Finance & Admin Management  Ensure accounts receivables are reviewed on a regular basis and controlled within acceptable limits. Ensure all project pre-invoices are issued, reviewed and final invoices dispatched in a timely manner. In conjunction with the Finance & Administration Manager, evaluate future resource requirements based on market conditions, past performance and projected performance and establish realistic yearly performance budget  Marketing and Business Development  Develop and maintain close professional relationships with existing and potential new clients in Singapore, in order to maintain and where possible increase the business activities of BELFOR within Singapore Inform responsible persons within key client and potential client organisations (including equipment end users, insurers, brokers, loss adjusters etc) about the features, advantages and benefits of BELFOR services through introductory letters, meetings, training sessions, seminars etc. Attend key industry functions, awards etc, in order to maintain relationships and network within the industry.  Sales Securing/Technical Consulting  Be actively involved in the technical aspects of securing recovery contracts and consultancy assignments.  This involves visits to fire/flood sites, identifying and meeting managers of organisations affected by such incidents, and their insurers and appointed loss adjusters, and informing them about the specialist services of BELFOR, and obtaining their confidence, in order to secure stabilisation services and recovery contracts. Ensure that all consulting assignments which are carried out by BELFOR specialists are conducted according to company guidelines.  In particular, ensure that BELFOR consulting services provide the highest value possible for the client. Review and approve all consulting reports and project quotations. Advise the team in regard to sales strategy and if necessary attend site to assist with negotiations.  Project Management  Ensure that all projects are managed in a professional manner as per company standards and procedures, in order to satisfy both client and company requirements and expectations.   Ensure that project sales and profitability objectives are met. Ensure the efficient utilisation of all branch resources, and other resources assigned to the branch on a project basis.  Performance Management  Review invoicing, jobs on order, accounts receivable on weekly basis, and take corrective action where necessary. Produce monthly reports related to the overall performance of the branch in respect to technical consulting and project related operations.  Human Resources  Ensure that all sales and operations staff are adequately trained in order to carry out assigned tasks, and where necessary facilitate refresher/additional training. Ensure that all subordinate employees are issued with performance objectives, appropriate to their role, and are thereafter reviewed at least twice annually Ensure that all personnel act only in the best interests of BELFOR Asia. Recruit in accordance with the business plan and current company recruitment policy.  Ensure the hired personnel perform to expectations, within their defined roles.  Finance & Admin Management  Ensure accounts receivables are reviewed on a regular basis and controlled within acceptable limits. Ensure all project pre-invoices are issued, reviewed and final invoices dispatched in a timely manner. In conjunction with the Finance & Administration Manager, evaluate future resource requirements based on market conditions, past performance and projected performance and establish realistic yearly performance budget

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Engineering & Operations Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. The role: Software Engineer - Singapore Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward. Responsibilities: - Write mobile applications, create robust high-volume production applications and develop prototypes quickly.
job_requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics/Mathematics, related field or equivalent practical experience. - Experience in mobile application development. - Programming experience in Java, Objective-C, C++, or Python. Preferred qualifications: - Deep technical knowledge of mobile application development (either Android or iOS). - Significant programming experience in either Java, Objective-C or C++.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWhy Standard Chartered? We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.  To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit.  It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. Why FM Technology? The Financial Markets IT function is responsible for the systems development and technology infrastructure which underpin the Bank’s services for Financial Markets clients. FM TPT is a dynamic and diverse team within the FM IT department spread across multiple global locations and is focused on enhancing the technical and operational capabilities of the Financial Markets trade and post trade functions. It is a forward thinking and highly productive area and an excellent place for technologists and associated support functions to succeed in a rapidly changing and challenging environment. Job Description The global securities transformation and settlements team requires a project manager to support the delivery of several technology work streams. This critical project role will incorporate many deliverables. The successful candidate will be an experienced project manager with a track record of 3 + years in delivering, complex projects. The successful candidate is expected to: Key Roles & Responsibilities Coordinating with cross discipline team members to make sure that all parties are on track with project requirements, deadlines, and schedules. Ensure that the project is managed in line with good project management practices Define and formulate the implementation plan (including key dependencies, resource requirements and interlocks Provide periodic project updates to project working group and steering committees Define and monitor at a work stream level key risk and issues and manage them as defined in PMP guidelines Work closely with the Group Functions and Business Areas to implement / enhance data quality controls and documentation. Preparing status reports by gathering, analysing and summarizing relevant information. Establishing effective project communication plans and ensuring their execution. Managing senior project stakeholder expectations on project delivery Facilitating change requests to ensure that all parties are informed of the impacts on schedule and budget. Conducting post project evaluation and identifying successful and unsuccessful project elements.

You can search and view current opportunities across our global organisation and apply immediately by visiting www.standardchartered.com. To help speed up your application, please note the following:  You will need to log in (or register if you are visiting our careers site for the first time) before you can apply for a specific role Some roles may require you to undertake an online talent assessment in addition to completing the application form (to facilitate this process it is preferable that you provide us with an email address as part of your contact information) We will ask you about your education, career history and skills and experience, it may be helpful to have this information at hand when completing your application  It usually takes 15 - 20 minutes to complete the application form; you can save your application at any time and return to complete it at your convenience. Diversity & Inclusion Standard Chartered is committed to diversity and inclusion. We believe that a work environment which embraces diversity will enable us to get the best out of the broadest spectrum of people to sustain strong business performance and competitive advantage. By building an inclusive culture, each employee can develop a sense of belonging, and have the opportunity to maximise their personal potential.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Accountant reports to the Finance Manager (FM) of the organisation. He/She is involved in most, if not all aspects of accounting and oversees the day-to-day activities of the accounting team. He/She ensures that the organisation's finance function is well organised as well as producing timely and accurate financial statements and management accounts, thus achieving compliance with corporate policies and statutory requirements. He/She analyses data and understands the financial performance and position of the organisation in order to develop suitable accounting policies to meet reporting requirements and to produce any special reports required by the management team.The Accountant's role often involves leading a team of finance and accounting specialists and working closely with the internal and external auditors, bankers, and regulators. He/She must keep current with changing statutory requirements and tax laws and determine the implications of such changes to financial reporting. He/She may also work with the FM or the leadership team to help define the organisation's overall finance strategy.
job_requirements: Requirements ~ Prepare accurate and timely financial statements. ~ Calculate taxable income and the income tax liabilities of the organisation. ~ Calculate the cost of different types of capital financial instruments and the overall costs of capital for the organisation. ~ Compile accurate tax-related information for the organisation. ~ Compute the valuation of business and financial assets using different models. ~ Ensure the respective privileges and rights are in place within the accounting information system for users with different job roles and functions. ~ Extract data and provide analysis for management using relevant accounting information systems or software. ~ Implement policies and procedures with emphasis on internal controls to prevent possible fraud and errors. ~ Maintain accurate journal entries and allocations. ~ Manage accounts payable and receivables to help the organisation determine working capital needs and funding strategies. ~ Operate accounting information systems efficiently and effectively. ~ Participate in budgeting and forecasting activities. ~ Plan and coordinate the annual financial audit process. ~ Prepare asset, liability, and capital account entries by compiling and analysing account information. ~ Prepare financial statements and disclosure notes. ~ Provide accurate and timely tax and financial reports to the relevant authorities. ~ Provide data in relation to assets, capital rationing and cost of capital. ~ Reconcile accounts and provide analysis for the organisations financial transactions. ~ Resolve issues and deficiencies arising from audit findings. ~ Respond to internal and external auditors on audit data, variances and audit findings.

job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements: Accounting knowledge Well versed in MS office Organized, neat and systematic Ability to multi-task Able to adhere to strict deadlines and the ability to work under pressure Good command of spoken and written English   Interested candidates, please send in your resume to: recruit @ dismanpower.com.sg & indicate in the subject as "Senior / Accounts Exec" We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.   DIS Manpower Pte Ltd EA License No: 08C3226 EA Personnel: Jennifer Ko Yi Jia EA Reg No: R1101603

job_requirements: RequirementsMinimum 8 Years in Detail engineering of Telecom systems for Onshore/Offshore fixed/floating Oil & Gas installations. Conversant with Industry norms for Telecom systems such PAGA, Telephony, Wireless, Access control, RFID etc. Experience in preparation and review of Specifications for Telecom systems. Exposure to brownfield works and site survey would be added advantage.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCircles.Life is World’s first and most successful digital telco. We have a mission: to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer through our customer-centric mobile platform and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar global telco industry. We launched our services in Singapore in 2016 and have since gained market share quickly while delivering best-in-class customer experience. Currently, Circles beats all other telcos on metrics like NPS, subscriber growth, average data used per subscriber and overall customer satisfaction. Do you want to get first-hand insights on how a rapidly scaling tech startup operate? Do you enjoy working within an entrepreneurial environment, having the personal freedom to act, and be part of a fun, energetic team who are running at full speed to ignite a digital disruption in telecommunications? If the answer is YES, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life! Job Description: We have an opening for a highly accomplished Senior DevOps Engineer with an entrepreneurial spirit and a maverick mentality, who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure at a rapidly scaling telco startup in Singapore. You will be responsible for deploying, automating, maintaining, troubleshooting and improving the systems that keep the backend infrastructure running smoothly. Your responsibilities are as per below.  Deploying, automating, maintaining and managing cloud-based production system. Ensuring the availability, performance, scalability and security of productions systems.   Building, releasing and configuration management of production systems.   Pre-production Acceptance Testing to help assure the quality of our products/services.   System troubleshooting and problem-solving across platform and application domains.   Suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements.   Evaluate new technology options and vendor products.   Ensuring critical system security through the use of best in class cloud security solutions.  What’s on Offer Circles.Life provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. In this role, you can expect:  Unique opportunity to be a part of innovating the telecommunications industry (Circles.Life is the only company of its kind in all of Asia!) Once in a lifetime chance to help shape a brand from the ground up. Autonomy in the role and in managing your own portfolio. Exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups. Attractive experience and compensation. Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment.
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements  Passionate about Technology, Telecommunications and Disruptive models A degree in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering, Information Technology or relevant Experience in management & integration of public cloud infrastructure (AWS) Good experience in AWS or GCP Architecture and Services. Ability to design applications on AWS taking advantage of disaster recovery design guideline Experience with distributed Source Code Management (SCM) tools, e.g. Git Experience with automation / operational provisioning tools, e.g. Ansible, Puppet or Chef Strong scripting capabilities: bash, perl or python preferred Integration experience with third party/open source system monitoring tools. E.g. Nagios, New Relic Experience on Docker System Experience on CI/CD e.g. Jenkins Experience with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)

job_requirements: Requirements Minimum 3-5 years of experience in network design/deployment. Excellent knowledge in Routing and switching, eg. BGP, OSPF, Multicast, VSS, spanning tree, MPLS L3VPN. Good knowledge of Firewall technologies eg. IPSEC VPN, SSL VPN, IPS/IDS, Cisco ASA, Firepower, Fortigate, Experience in wireless setup eg. Cisco WLC, Aruba Data centre technologies, eg. Cisco Nexus VDC, VPC, FEX, VXLAN, ACI. Good knowledge in network access control(NAC) product, eg Aruba Clearpass Policy Manager, Cisco ISE. Excellent interpersonal & communication skills  Possess at least a Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, or Professional Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent Current CCNA/CCNP qualified with related professional experience, CCIE would be an advantage.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCircles.Life is World’s first and most successful digital telco. We have a mission: to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer through our customer centric mobile platform and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar global telco industry. We launched our services in Singapore in 2016 and have since gained market share quickly while delivering best-in-class customer experience. Currently Circles beats all other telcos on metrics like NPS, subscriber growth, average data used per subscriber and overall customer satisfaction.     We have an opening for a Senior Software Engineer, Mobile Application (Android) who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure at a rapidly scaling telco startup in Singapore. Do you want to get first hand insights on how a rapidly scaling tech startup operate? Do you enjoy working within an entrepreneurial environment, having the personal freedom to act, and be part of a fun, energetic team who are running at full speed to ignite a digital disruption in telecommunications? If the answer is YES, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life! Job Description We have an opening for a skillful Senior Android Developer with an entrepreneurial spirit and an enduring mentality, who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure at a rapidly scaling telco startup in Singapore. We are talking about an opportunity to really get in the game at a high growth startup with the regional scale, reach, and a mission to disrupt the telecommunications industry in South East Asia while building a world class digital telco. As a Senior Android Developer, you will be working with our team to create a suite of world class apps which will WOW our customers and the public, just like how our technology does. As a key member of our team, you will be:  Taking ownership for the suite of applications Involved in the entire lifecycle of mobile application development Working on code analysis and optimisation of applications Identifying and recommending architectural and technical enhancement features Working on design enhancements Applying your creativity and critical thinking skills to solve challenging problems  What’s on offer: Circles.Life provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. In this role, you can expect:  Unique opportunity to be a part of innovating the telecommunications industry (Circles.Life is the only company of its kind in all of Asia!). Once in a lifetime chance to help shape a brand from the ground up. Autonomy in the role and in managing your own portfolio. Exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups. Attractive experience and compensation. Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment.
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements  Passion for Technology, Telecommunications and Disruptive models A Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering 3+ years of working experience in Android Programming (Java, Android SDK) 1+ years of working experience in Android NDK (C/C++, JNI, Android NDK) A strong Java programming and design patterns foundation Portfolio of published applications Good communication and interpersonal communications skills Solid experience in developing consumer facing mobile applications and integrate it with the web services Proficient understanding of code versioning tool such as Git Knowledge of C, C++ and VoIP technology and protocols such as SIP, SDP, RTP/RTCP, Audio/Video codec will be a plus

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesScope Working for ISS Facility Services Group Risk Management to support the Global Key Accounts contracts, which are global facility management contracts comprising multiple premises globally. Purpose The Manager’s role is to establish and ensure ISS complies with the internal key controls related to both internal key risks as well as industry regulations, laws and contractual obligations. The Manager works cross-functionally and cross countries to determine and support process and control improvements ensuring adherence to global controls, governance and legislation. To provide the necessary advice, guidance and support to the regional account management structure so that they may in turn direct & coach their respective teams. Overall responsibility for risk management in line with the ISS ERM framework The role is positioned in Group Risk Management reporting to a Director in Group Risk Management with a dotted reporting line into the regional account operations leadership team. Key Responsibilities:  Manage, lead and develop the regional account operations teams in relation to the ISS ERM framework. Support the regional services/functional leads ensuring the ISS team complies with all relevant regulatory, industry legislation, contractual obligations and controls as detailed in agreed polices, standards and procedures. Utilise and manage the ERM RiskManagement@ISS concept, to capture and identify emerging risks, risk events and control compliance this includes: sample testing, reviewing and challenging control status and evidence; control effectiveness reviews. Contract support in respect to controls (day to day support) related to following areas 	 Manage, report and lead risk events Ensuring rigorous root cause analysis Capture and manage corrective action reporting internally and externally Control effectiveness review Review documentation for key controls Control improvement recommendation to Group Risk Management and Country Management Communicate and track progress to successful completion, with controls being accurate and functionally efficient   Provide data to be utilised within reports for senior management teams to highlight any issues or trends that pose a risk to ISS and the client. Communicate, engage, train and support implementation of emerging control requirements with management and the wider operations. Control improvement recommendation to Group Risk Management via the ERM framework and Support to ongoing ERM framework embedment. Proactively support and advocate group concept deployment ensuring control and compliance touchpoints are implemented and managed. Support functional managers to identify areas of potential process and control improvements. Instil a continuous improvement culture and project management discipline throughout the organisation. Document and report project deliverables to senior management and stakeholders, communicating time frame and procedures for accomplishing corrective actions. Support functional managers to identify areas of potential process improvements.
job_requirements: RequirementsPersonal specification Qualifications  A master or bachelor degree within audit, finance or risk management Fluent in written and verbal English  Skills / Experience / Attributes   Demonstrate an understanding of compliance and risk management Comfortable working to tight deadlines Interpreting, implementing and working with an ERM framework within the 1LoD Process risk and control assessments, a proven to identify control weaknesses and gaps The courage and ability to provide constructive challenge to process experts where appropriate Control design and implementation Strong written and verbal communication skills including presentation skills High level of flexibility and a positive attitude to innovation and change Be willing to travel Demonstrate high level of governance understanding Development of reporting skills, as information will need to be communicated to all levels within the organisation, including ISS and client global senior management teams

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout the Company Circles.Life is a young, innovative and energetic digital telco with a mission: to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer. We have strong local roots and we are the first digital telco in Singapore creating a customer centric mobile platform. Our aim is to make the customers’ life simpler and happier by giving them power over their mobile needs. Not only do we promote customers building their own plans, so they only pay for what they want, but our services seamlessly evolve with their needs. We believe our customers deserve more, and we give it to them. One Plan, Unlimited Me. Circles Asia and Circles.Life are brought to you by Liberty Wireless Pte. Ltd., a Singapore company incorporated in 2014. Liberty Wireless shareholders are established individuals and institutions with deep experience in the telco sector from Singapore and the region. It was set up by a team who is passionate about changing the regional mobile telco landscape to make things better for customers because we believe they should get more out of life. More importantly, they want to set an example of telco innovation for the region, from our home base in Singapore. Responsibilities We have an opening for a highly responsible Product Manager with an entrepreneurial spirit and a dedicated attitude, who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure at a rapidly scaling telco startup in Singapore. We are talking about an opportunity to really get in the game at a high growth startup with the regional scale, reach, and a mission to disrupt the telecommunications industry in South East Asia while building a world class digital telco. Do you want to get first hand insights on how a rapidly scaling tech startup operate? Do you enjoy working within an entrepreneurial environment, having personal freedom to act, and be part of a fun, energetic team who are running at full speed to ignite a digital disruption in telecommunications? If the answer is YES, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life! The Product Manager at Circles.Life operates at the exciting intersection of Consumer Mobile Technology Services, Strategy & Marketing. You will be responsible for product strategy, competitive intelligence, and contribute to design/pricing of packages and plans in line with our highly differentiated positioning. Your mission is to continuously understand the digital customer needs and come up with telco products that fit their needs and align with company plans and resources. You are as much at ease in an industry littered with jargon as you are with exploiting the power of analysis to communicate your views. In this position, your responsibilities will encompass the following:  Develop strategy and roadmap for future products to fulfill user requirements. Responsible for customer analysis, design to delivery (including quality assurance) of fully developed products that are ready for customer use Prepare and deliver product presentations, product vision, and strategy Design, develop and manage activities from product definition & planning to production and release Provide timely and accurate information and status updates to key stakeholders Act as primary point of contact to successfully release new products on time and within budget Define metrics and KPI to measure the success of the projects Drive and provide support to all aspects of the product development plan including pricing and positioning Contribute ideas and recommendations toward product, process and system improvement Understand data savvy customer expectations and industry best practices, including keeping abreast of the technology landscape Perform in-depth opportunity/competitive analysis Keep customer experience first, while developing ways to bolster Customer Acquisition, Usage, and Retention  What’s on offer Circles.Life provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. In this role, you can expect:  Unique opportunity to be a part of the digital disruption in telecommunication (Circles.Life is the only company of its kind in all of Asia!) Autonomy in the role and in managing your own portfolio Exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups Attractive experience and compensation Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment
job_requirements: Requirements A degree in Business, Marketing or Technology Extensive experience in new product development Interest in telco industry Experience in pricing and segmentation Passionate about technology and disruptive models Understanding & interest in telco products, margins, and insights Staunch believer in continuous self-improvement Project Management Skills Research and Analysis skills Creative ideas Fast Learner, structured thinking Enjoy working in a multicultural environment Exceptional oral and written communication skills

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Accounts Assistant reports to the Accountant to support the finance department in carrying out the responsibilities of the accounting department. He/She covers duties such as work that is specific to accounts receivable, accounts payable, tax filing, data compilation, billing, payroll or other accounting tasks. He/She works specifically with accruals, fixed assets accounting or the monthly and yearly finalisation of accounts for audit purposes. He/She assists with the preparation of trial balance, basic financial statements and simple consolidated financial statements. He/She may be called on to participate in ad-hoc finance-related projects and systems testing when necessary.
job_requirements: Requirements1.  Accounting  To ensure that all receivable is processed accurately on a timely manner and in accordance to the internal control within the Company: 	 Setting up new client database in accounting system Coding of client’s invoices and input into accounting system Prepare inter-company billings Review AR ageing reports follow up with clients on outstanding debts Prepare AR reconciliation to Gross Billings Verify and calculate all extensions and totals on invoices (calculating and taking discounts when applicable) Prepare the monthly statement of accounts to clients Prepare intercompany AR revaluation Explore the use of online banking for electronic payments Correspond with clients and respond to inquiries Prepare month end Balance Sheet Schedules   To ensure that general and subsidiary ledgers are kept for prompt monthly closing within T+5: 	 Prepare and enter general ledger journals for receipts Reconciliation of bank accounts, sub-ledger to control account and inter-company accounts Prepare and enter general ledger journals for GST and VAT   Support external audit requirements, including preparation of audit schedules and ensuring timely resolution of audit findings Ensure accounting records and systems are in compliance with Group policies, approved accounting standards and statutory requirements Develop and maintain a filing system   Ensure accounting records are filed in chronological order on a daily basis  2.  Taxation  Ensure compliance of corporate income tax matters in terms of timely submission through preparation of tax schedules and internal income tax computation. Handle VAT preparation to be ready for review by supervisor. Drive the claim of foreign VAT through VAT consultants. Handle GST quarterly preparation to be ready for review by supervisor.    3.  Financial Planning  To support Financial Planning and Analysis (FPNA) Executive for the upgrade of financial systems and tools to automate budgeting and reporting functions which will enable management to quickly and accurately assess financial performance and trends To assist in the quarterly forecasting and annual budgeting.    4.   Systems  Maintenance of mapping tables in SAGE CRM Maintenance of contract maintenance in SAGE ACCPAC Assist in testing and development of new systems    5.   Governmental Survey:  Ensure consistency in statistic reports    6.  Any other duties that will be designated by the superiors to meet exigencies of work.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOVERVIEW To help ensure legal compliance with all relevant local statutory requirements and ensure the Environmental Health and Safety Management System (EHSMS) remains in a process of continual improvement. Develop, build and maintain close relationships with business leaders and actively promote health and safety across the Asia Pacific Region. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Management of the EHSMS including reviewing, updating and implementing relevant health and safety documentation and continually improving the EHSMS compliance score. Asist in the development and delivery of the health and safety strategy across the Asia Pacific region. Work with business leaders to drive EHS improvements against Goals and objectives (as part of the overall performance requirements). Conduct or participate in emergency evacuation drills and update emergency information and signage. Pre-qualify and approve contractors / Review Risk assessments and method statements and review method statements and risk assessments for outside vendors/contractors coming to NBCUniversal premises. Conduct risk assessments according to relevant guidelines, covering events, incidental tasks, etc). Report major incidents immediately to Corp EHS and appropriate external agency and lead accident investigations, (log, and determine root cause, corrective actions). Review and update site training matrix and arrange training for team members (first aid, fire warden, etc) and induction for new starters. Host Safety Meetings (fire wardens, first aiders, EHS Committee, etc). Support Security, Crisis Management, Business Continuity program. Liaise with external regulators as necessary. Provide the International EHS Director with weekly EHS summary report. Undertake regular maintenance of Gensuite, including logging employee labour hours worked for I&I rate, verify/correct metrics for quarterly roll-up, monitor metrics (action closure rates, trend injury data and other metrics to identify improvement plans. Manage the health and safety requirements of all special events (i.e. Cares Day) and where necessary undertake site visits, conduct risk assessments and provide safety briefings. When required assist International Security Director with measuring compliance with NBCU Physical Security Infrastructure Standards. Assist with the management and coordination of local security service providers (including landlord guard management and CCTV services) and ensuring compliance with contract requirements. Responding to emergency incidents.  Liaising with locally based external agencies including Police and other Government Agencies on security or criminal investigation issues as directed by VP and/or Director International Security. Auditing compliance against NBCUniversal standards and procedures and local legal requirements. Any other duties as seen reasonable by the International EHS Director.
